src: सबै नोटहरूराम्ररी पल्टाउँदा - आफ्ना औँलाहरूले धेरै अनावश्यक गति नबनाउने प्रयास गगर्दै तपाईंको हात सम्भव भएसम्म शान्त छ भनि सु निश्चित गर्नुहोस्। यो तरिकाले, तपाईं सम्भव भएसम्म कम थाक्नुहुनेछ। याद गर्नुहोस् पियानोमा जस्तो अतिरिक्त आवाजको लागि कुञ्जीहरूलाई धेरै बलले थिच्नु आवश्यक छैन। अकोर्डियनमा, अतिरिक्त आवाज प्राप्त गर्न, तपाईं थप दवाब वा वेगका साथ बेलोजको प्रयोग गर्नुहुन्छ।
mt: 1. When turning pages - try to keep your fingers as still as possible. This will help you avoid cramping. Remember, you don't need to press the keys on a piano very hard to get extra sound. On an accordion, you get extra sound by pressing harder or faster with bellows.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: सबै नोटहरूराम्ररी पल्टाउँदा - आफ्ना औँलाहरूले धेरै अनावश्यक गति नबनाउने प्रयास गगर्दै तपाईंको हात सम्भव भएसम्म शान्त छ भनि सु निश्चित गर्नुहोस्। यो तरिकाले, तपाईं सम्भव भएसम्म कम थाक्नुहुनेछ। याद गर्नुहोस् पियानोमा जस्तो अतिरिक्त आवाजको लागि कुञ्जीहरूलाई धेरै बलले थिच्नु आवश्यक छैन। अकोर्डियनमा, अतिरिक्त आवाज प्राप्त गर्न, तपाईं थप दवाब वा वेगका साथ बेलोजको प्रयोग गर्नुहुन्छ।

This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. src: ओभरस्क्यान चलचित्र डिभिडिटमा रूपान्तरण गर्दा सबैभन्दा सामान्य समस्या हो। सामान्य जनतालाई खुशी पार्ने किसिमले धेरै जसो टेलिभिजनहरू बनाइन्छन्। त्यसकारण, तपाईंले टिभीमा देख्नुहुने सबै चीजमा सीमाना काटौती, माथि, तल र छेउहरू हुन्थ्यो। यो छविले पूरै स्क्रिन छोप्दछ भन्ने सुनिश्चित गर्नको लागि बनाइएको हो। त्यसलाई ओभरस्क्यान भनिन्छ। दुर्भाग्यवश, तपाईंले डिभिडि बनाउँदा, यसका बोर्डरहरू पनि सम्भावित रूपमा काटिनेछन् र यदि भिडियोमा उपशीर्षकहरू तल्लो भागको एकदमै नजिक भएमा, तिनीहरूलाई पूर्ण रूपमा देखाइनेछैन।
mt: The most common problem when converting an over-the-air movie to DVD.  Most television shows are made to please the general public.  Therefore, there are borders at the top, bottom, and sides.  This is to ensure that the entire screen is covered.  This is called over-scanning.  Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, these borders will also be cut off and if subtitles are at the bottom of the video, they will not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: ओभरस्क्यान चलचित्र डिभिडिटमा रूपान्तरण गर्दा सबैभन्दा सामान्य समस्या हो। सामान्य जनतालाई खुशी पार्ने किसिमले धेरै जसो टेलिभिजनहरू बनाइन्छन्। त्यसकारण, तपाईंले टिभीमा देख्नुहुने सबै चीजमा सीमाना काटौती, माथि, तल र छेउहरू हुन्थ्यो। यो छविले पूरै स्क्रिन छोप्दछ भन्ने सुनिश्चित गर्नको लागि बनाइएको हो। त्यसलाई ओभरस्क्यान भनिन्छ। दुर्भाग्यवश, तपाईंले डिभिडि बनाउँदा, यसका बोर्डरहरू पनि सम्भावित रूपमा काटिनेछन् र यदि भिडियोमा उपशीर्षकहरू तल्लो भागको एकदमै नजिक भएमा, तिनीहरूलाई पूर्ण रूपमा देखाइनेछैन।
mt: The most common problem when converting an over-the-air movie to DVD.  Most television shows are made to please the general public.  Therefore, there are borders at the top, bottom, and sides.  This is to ensure that the entire screen is covered.  This is called over-scanning.  Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, these borders will also be cut off and if subtitles are at the bottom of the video, they will not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: अमेरिकी योजना तीन विभिन्न दिशाहरूबाट समन्वय गरिएको आक्रमण सुरू गर्ने भनी भर परेको थियो। जेनेरल जोन क्याडवाल्डरले कुनै पनि सुदृढीकरणलाई रोक्न बोर्डनटाउनको ब्रिटिस गढको विरूद्ध ध्यान भड्काउका लागि आक्रमण सुरु गर्थे। जनरल जेम्स ईविङ्गले ट्रेन्टन फेरीमा नदी पार गर्न 700 मिलिशिया लिने गर्थे, असुनपिंक क्रिकमा भएको पुल कब्जा गर्थे र कुनै पनि शत्रू सेनालाई भाग्नबाट रोक्दथे। 2400 मानिसको मुख्य आक्रमक बलले ट्रेन्टनबाट नौ माइल उत्तरमा नदी पार गर्नेछ र त्यसपछि पूर्व-प्रभात आक्रमण सुरु गर्न, एक ग्रिनको मातहतमा र अर्को सुलिभनको मातहतमा गरी दुई समूहमा विभाजित हुनेछन्।
mt: 3 American plans were coordinated to attack from three different directions. General John Cadwalader attacked the British garrison in Bordentown to draw attention away from reinforcements. General James Ewing was to cross the Trenton Ferry with 700 militia, capture the Assunpink Creek bridge, and prevent any enemy forces from escaping. The main attacking force of 2400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton and then attack from the east, with one group in the Great Bridge and the other in the Sullivans Bridge.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: जुलाई 4 मा काङ्ग्रेसले यसलाई ग्रहण गरेपछि काङ्ग्रेसका अध्यक्ष जोन ह्यान्कक र सचिव चार्ल्स थमसनले हस्ताक्षर गरेको हस्तलिखित अभिलेख केही ब्लकमा जोन डनलपको छापाखानामा पठाइएको थियो। रातभरी 150 र 200 का बिचमा प्रतिलिपिहरू बनाइए, जुन अब “डन्ल्याप ब्रोडसाइडहरू” भनेर चिनिन्छन्। यस कागजातको पहिलो सार्वजनिक पठन जुलाई 8 मा जोन निक्सनले इन्डिपेन्डेन्स हलको आँगनमा गरेका थिए। एउटा जुलाई 6 मा जर्ज वाशिङटनलाई पठाइएको थियो, जसले त्यो जुलाई 9 मा न्युयोर्कमा आफ्ना सेनालाई पढेर सुनाउन लगाएका थिए। त्यसको एउटा प्रतिलिपि अगस्त 10 मा लन्डन पुग्यो। 25 डनल्याप ब्रोडसाईडहरूलाई कागजातको सबैभन्दा पुरानो रहिरहेका प्रतिलिपिहरू हुन् भनेर चिनिन्छ। मूल हस्तलिखित प्रतिलिपि बाँचेको छैन।
mt: On July 4, after Congress had adopted it, the handwritten document was signed by Congress president John Hancock and secretary Charles Thomson. It was then sent to John Dickinson's printing house in a few blocks. That night, 150 to 200 copies were made, which are now known as "Dunlap Broadsides". The first public reading of the document was on July 8 by John Nixon in the Independence Hall courtyard. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who read it to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy arrived in London on August 10. The oldest surviving copies are 25 Dunlap Broadsides, and the original handwritten copy has not survived.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: उपनिवेशवादीहरूले यो गतिविधि हेरेर पनि सुदृढीकरणका लागि आह्वान गरेका थिए। अगाडिको स्थानलाई सुदृढ बनाउने सैनिकहरूमा कर्नेल जोन स्टार्क र जेम्स रिड (पछि दुवै जना जनरल बने) को मातहतका 200 मानिसका पहिलो र तेस्रो न्यु ह्याम्पसायर पल्टन समावेश थिए। स्टार्कका मानिसहरूले उपनिवेशवादीको स्थितिको उत्तरी छेउमा बारमा स्थान लिए। जब प्रायद्वीपको उत्तरपूर्वमा मिस्टिक नदीको किनारमा न्यून ज्वारले प्वाल बनायो, तिनीहरूले सानो तटमा पानीको किनारा अन्त्य हुने उत्तरसम्म छोटो ढुङ्गाको पर्खालको घेराबार तुरुन्तै लम्ब्याए। ग्रिडले वा स्टार्कले बारका अगाडि करिब 100 फिट (30 मिटर) को हिस्सेदारी राखे र आदेश दिए कि जबसम्म नियमित व्यक्तिहरू पार गर्दैनन्, तबसम्म कसैले आगो लगाउनेछैन।
mt: Imperialists also watched the activity and called for reinforcement. The first and third New Hampshire Paltoons under Colonel John Stark and James Reed (both later generals) were included in the soldiers who strengthened the position. Stark's men took the position on the north side of the bar. When the low tide of the Mystic River formed a pool on the north-eastern side of the peninsula, they immediately extended a short stone wall around the small beach to the north end of the water's edge. The grid or Stark left about 100 feet (30 meters) of the bar in front and ordered that no one would set fire until regular people passed through.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: प्राचीन चीनसँग विभिन्न समय अवधिहरू देखाउने फरक तरिका थियो; चीनको प्रत्येक चरण वा सत्तामा रहेको परिवार विशिष्ट वंश थियो। साथै प्रत्येक राजवंशको बिचमा विभाजित प्रान्तहरूको अस्थिर अवधि पनि थियो।। यी अवधिहरूमध्ये हान र जीन राज वंशको बिचमा भएको 60 वर्षसम्म चलिरहेको तीन राज्यहरूको युगको अवधि थियो। यी अवधिमा सिंहासनका लागि युद्ध गरिरहेका धेरै कुलीनहरूबीचमा भयङ्कर युद्ध भयो। तीन अधिराज्य प्राचीन चीनको इतिहासमा एउटा रक्तपातपूर्ण युग थियो जसमा सि'आनको महान् दरबारमा उच्च स्थानको आसनका लागि लड्दा हजारौँ मानिसहरूको मृत्यु भयो।
mt: There were different ways of showing different time periods; each Chinese dynasty or ruling family had a particular lineage. In addition, there were also periods of instability between the provinces of each dynasty. The period of the Three Kingdoms, which lasted for 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties, was one of these periods. There were many clans fighting for the throne, and there were brutal wars between them. The Three Kingdoms was a bloody period in the history of ancient China, in which thousands of people died in the battles for the throne in the Great Hall of Chang'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: सेना कमिला कोलोनीहरू विभिन्न चरणहरूमा मार्च र गुँड बनाउने गर्दछन्। अफ्रिकाको पूर्वी तटमा हिन्द महासागरमा पूर्वी अफ्रिकी टापुहरू छन्। उपलब्ध खाना कम भएको बेला उपनिवेशले खानाबन्दीको चरण सुरु गर्छ। दैनिक परिवर्तन भएको बेला यस चरणको दौरान, उपनिवेशले अस्थायी गुँडहरू बनाउँछ। यी प्रत्येक घुमन्ते हिंसात्मक व्यवहार वा मार्चहरू लगभग 17 दिनसम्म रहन्छन्।
mt: The army of the colonies is marching and building trenches in various stages. There are Eastern African islands in the Eastern coast of Africa in the Indian Ocean. When the food is scarce, the colony starts the stage of the food blockade. During this stage, when the daily changes, the colony builds temporary trenches. These each rotating violent behavior or marches last about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: सेना कमिला कोलोनीहरू विभिन्न चरणहरूमा मार्च र गुँड बनाउने गर्दछन्। अफ्रिकाको पूर्वी तटमा हिन्द महासागरमा पूर्वी अफ्रिकी टापुहरू छन्। उपलब्ध खाना कम भएको बेला उपनिवेशले खानाबन्दीको चरण सुरु गर्छ। दैनिक परिवर्तन भएको बेला यस चरणको दौरान, उपनिवेशले अस्थायी गुँडहरू बनाउँछ। यी प्रत्येक घुमन्ते हिंसात्मक व्यवहार वा मार्चहरू लगभग 17 दिनसम्म रहन्छन्।
mt: The army of the colonies is marching and building trenches in various stages. There are Eastern African islands in the Eastern coast of Africa in the Indian Ocean. When the food is scarce, the colony starts the stage of the food blockade. During this stage, when the daily changes, the colony builds temporary trenches. These each rotating violent behavior or marches last about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: शरीरविज्ञान र व्यवहारका बारेमा धेरैको मनाइने ताल प्राय: अन्तरजात चक्रको उपस्थिति र जैविक घडीकामार्फत उनीहरूको उत्पादनमा निर्भर गर्छन्‌। आवधिक लयहरू, जुन केवल बाह्य आवधिक सङ्केतहरूका प्रतिक्रिया मात्र होइनन्, जुन धेरै जस्ता किटाणु, ढुसी, बोटविरुवा र जनावरहरू लगायत जीवित प्राणीहरूका लागि दस्तावेज गरिएका छन्। जैविक घडीहरू बाह्य धक्काको अनुपस्थितिमा समेत स्वतन्त्र-चल्ने चक्रलाई निरन्तरता दिने आत्मनिर्भर दोलकहरू हुन्।
mt: The circadian rhythms of most organisms are determined by a combination of the presence of external cues and internal biological clocks. Rhythms that persist in the absence of external cues are called free-running rhythms. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that continue to run in the absence of external cues.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: जनसङ्ख्या भनेको कुनै निर्दिष्ट भौगोलिक क्षेत्र भित्रका विशिष्ट प्रजातिहरूका जीवहरूको संग्रह हो। जनसङ्ख्यामा भएका सबै व्यक्तिहरू विशिष्ट फिनोटाइपिक लक्षणको सन्दर्भमा एकसमान हुँदा तिनीहरूलाई मोनोमोर्फिक भनेर चिनिन्छ। जब व्यक्तिहरूले कुनै विशेष गुणका धेरै रूपहरू देखाउँछन् तिनीहरू बहुरूपी हुन्छन्।
mt: A population is a set of individuals of the same species, genus, or family, living in a given geographic area. If all individuals in a population have the same phenotype with respect to a particular trait, they are said to be monomorphic. If individuals exhibit a range of different phenotypes, they are said to be polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: जनसङ्ख्या भनेको कुनै निर्दिष्ट भौगोलिक क्षेत्र भित्रका विशिष्ट प्रजातिहरूका जीवहरूको संग्रह हो। जनसङ्ख्यामा भएका सबै व्यक्तिहरू विशिष्ट फिनोटाइपिक लक्षणको सन्दर्भमा एकसमान हुँदा तिनीहरूलाई मोनोमोर्फिक भनेर चिनिन्छ। जब व्यक्तिहरूले कुनै विशेष गुणका धेरै रूपहरू देखाउँछन् तिनीहरू बहुरूपी हुन्छन्।

If all individuals in a population have the same phenotype with respect to a particular trait, they are said to be monomorphic. If individuals exhibit a range of different phenotypes, they are said to be polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: प्रकृतिमा आधारित पर्यटनले बोटबिरुवा र पशु वन्यजीवन सहितको दृश्यहरू उपभोग गर्ने उद्देश्यले प्राकृतिक क्षेत्रहरूको भ्रमण गर्न रुचि राख्ने मानिसहरूलाई आकर्षित गर्छ। साइटमा हुने गतिविधिहरूका उदाहरणहरूमा शिकार गर्ने, माछा मार्ने, फोटोग्राफी, चरा हेर्न र पार्कहरूमा जाने र पर्यावरणका बारेमा जानकारीको अध्ययन गर्ने कार्य समावेश छन्। एक उदाहरण भनेको भ्रमण गर्ने, फोटोग्राफी गर्ने र बोर्निओमा ओर्गानगाटुआङ्गस्‌को बारेमा सिक्ने हो।
mt: Nature-based tourism is the act of visiting natural sites for recreational or educational purposes. The purpose of nature-based tourism is to enjoy the scenery, flora, and fauna of a natural site. Examples of activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks to learn about the environment. One example is to visit, photograph, and learn about the orangutan in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: हरेक बिहान, व्यक्तिहरू आफ्नो कार्यस्थानमा जानका लागि कारमा साना सहरहरू छोड्छन् र तिनीहरूलाई अरूले पार गर्छन् जसको कार्य गन्तव्य तिनीहरूले भर्खर छोडेको स्थान हो। यस डाइनामिक यातायात सटलमा सबैजना कुनै न कुनै रूपमा निजी कारमा आधारित यातायात प्रणालीसँग जोडिएका छन् र त्यसको समर्थनमा छन्। विज्ञानले अहिले सङ्केत गर्दछ कि यो विशाल कार्बन अर्थतन्त्रले यसको एक स्थिर अवस्थाबाट जैविक क्षेत्रलाई हटाएको छ जसले विगत दुई मिलियन वर्षदेखि मानव विकासलाई समर्थन गरेको छ।
mt: Every morning, people leave their homes in small towns and drive their cars to their workplaces, where they are picked up by other people driving their cars to the places they just left. This dynamic traffic system is based on all people being in private cars, and supporting that system. Science now indicates that this vast carbon economy has removed the planet from a stable state that has supported human development for the past two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: परमाणुलाई सबै पदार्थ निर्माण गर्ने एउटा आधारभूत ब्लकको रूपमा लिन सकिन्छ। सरलीकृत बोहरा मोडेलकाअनुसार इलेक्ट्रोनहरू द्वारा केन्द्रित केन्द्रीय नाभिकको केन्द्रबिन्दु हुन्छ भन्ने जटिल इकाइहो जुन सूर्यको परिक्रमा गर्ने ग्रहहरू जस्तै छ - चित्र 11.11 हेर्नुहोस्। न्यूक्लियसमा दुई कणहरू हुन्छन् - न्यूट्रोन र प्रोटोनहरू। प्रोटोनहरूमा सकारात्मक विद्युतीय चार्ज हुन्छ जबकि न्यूट्रोनहरूमा कुनै चार्ज हुँदैन। इलेक्ट्रोनहरूमा नकारात्मक विद्युतीय चार्ज हुन्छ।
mt: 11.11: The atom can be thought of as a basic building block of all matter. In the simplified Bohr model, electrons are arranged around a central nucleus, which is the complex unit that orbits the sun like the planets - see Figure 11.11. The nucleus has two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: परमाणुलाई सबै पदार्थ निर्माण गर्ने एउटा आधारभूत ब्लकको रूपमा लिन सकिन्छ। सरलीकृत बोहरा मोडेलकाअनुसार इलेक्ट्रोनहरू द्वारा केन्द्रित केन्द्रीय नाभिकको केन्द्रबिन्दु हुन्छ भन्ने जटिल इकाइहो जुन सूर्यको परिक्रमा गर्ने ग्रहहरू जस्तै छ - चित्र 11.11 हेर्नुहोस्। न्यूक्लियसमा दुई कणहरू हुन्छन् - न्यूट्रोन र प्रोटोनहरू। प्रोटोनहरूमा सकारात्मक विद्युतीय चार्ज हुन्छ जबकि न्यूट्रोनहरूमा कुनै चार्ज हुँदैन। इलेक्ट्रोनहरूमा नकारात्मक विद्युतीय चार्ज हुन्छ।

In the simplified Bohr model, electrons are arranged around a central nucleus, which is the complex unit that orbits the sun like the planets - see Figure 11.11. The nucleus has two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: बाइनरी नम्बरहरूको रूपमा कोड गरिएका प्रयोगमा रहेका सबै कम्प्युटरहरू जानकारीको हेरफेरमा आधारित छन्। जोडी अङ्कमा दुईमध्ये एउटा मात्रै मान हुन सक्दछ, जस्तै 00 वा 11 र यी अङ्कहरूलाई जोडी अङ्कहरू - वा कम्प्युटर जार्गन प्रयोग गर्नका लागि बिट्स भनिन्छ।
mt: All computers are based on the manipulation of binary numbers. Only one of two digits can be 1, such as 00 or 11, and these digits are called bits or computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: बाइनरी नम्बरहरूको रूपमा कोड गरिएका प्रयोगमा रहेका सबै कम्प्युटरहरू जानकारीको हेरफेरमा आधारित छन्। जोडी अङ्कमा दुईमध्ये एउटा मात्रै मान हुन सक्दछ, जस्तै 00 वा 11 र यी अङ्कहरूलाई जोडी अङ्कहरू - वा कम्प्युटर जार्गन प्रयोग गर्नका लागि बिट्स भनिन्छ।
mt: All computers are based on the manipulation of binary numbers. Only one of two digits can be 1, such as 00 or 11, and these digits are called bits or computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: विद्यार्थीको लेखन ब्लगहरूले पनि सुधार्न मद्दत गर्छन्। जब कुनै विद्यार्थीले आफ्नो ब्लग कमजोर व्याकरण र हिज्जेसहित सुरु गर्छन्, त्यसलाई दर्शकको उपस्थितिले सामान्य रूपमा परिवर्तन गराइदिन्छ। विद्यार्थीहरू प्रायजसो सबैभन्दा महत्त्वपूर्ण दर्शक भएकाले, ब्लग लेखकले आलोचनाबाट जोगिन लेखनलाई सुधार गर्न कोसिस गर्न थाल्छन्। साथै, ब्लगिङले “विद्यार्थीहरूलाई उनीहरूको वरपरको विश्वका बारेमा थप समझदार हुन बाध्य पार्छ।” श्रोताको चासो जगाउने आवश्यकताले विद्यार्थीहरूलाई चलाख र चाखलाग्दो हुन प्रेरणा प्रदान गर्छ (Toto, 2004)। ब्लगिङ एउटा उपकरण हो जसले सहयोगलाई प्रोत्साहित गर्दछ र विद्यार्थीहरूलाई परम्परागत विद्यालय दिनभन्दा पनि राम्रो शिक्षा विस्तार गर्न प्रोत्साहित गर्दछ। ब्लगको उचित उपयोगले “विद्यार्थीहरूलाई थप विश्लेषणात्मक र आलोचनात्मक बन्न सशक्त गर्दछ; इन्टरनेट सामग्रीहरूलाई सक्रिय रूपमा जवाफ दिएर, विद्यार्थीहरूले अरूको लेखनको सन्दर्भमा आफ्नो स्थिति परिभाषित गर्न सक्दछन् र साथै विशेष विषयहरूमा उनीहरूको आफ्नै दृष्टिकोणको रूपरेखा बनाउन सक्छन्” (ओराभेक, 2002)।
mt: Student writing blogs also help to improve. When a student starts a blog with poor grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience usually corrects this. Students usually have the most important audience, so the blogger will try to improve their writing from criticism. Also, blogging “brings students into contact with the world around them.” The desire to be heard by an audience motivates students to be more intelligent and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that encourages collaboration and motivates students to extend their learning beyond the traditional classroom. The proper use of blogs “helps students to become more analytical and critical; they respond actively to Internet materials, students can define their position in relation to the writings of others, and they can outline their own perspective on specific topics” (O’Reilly, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: विद्यार्थीको लेखन ब्लगहरूले पनि सुधार्न मद्दत गर्छन्। जब कुनै विद्यार्थीले आफ्नो ब्लग कमजोर व्याकरण र हिज्जेसहित सुरु गर्छन्, त्यसलाई दर्शकको उपस्थितिले सामान्य रूपमा परिवर्तन गराइदिन्छ। विद्यार्थीहरू प्रायजसो सबैभन्दा महत्त्वपूर्ण दर्शक भएकाले, ब्लग लेखकले आलोचनाबाट जोगिन लेखनलाई सुधार गर्न कोसिस गर्न थाल्छन्। साथै, ब्लगिङले “विद्यार्थीहरूलाई उनीहरूको वरपरको विश्वका बारेमा थप समझदार हुन बाध्य पार्छ।” श्रोताको चासो जगाउने आवश्यकताले विद्यार्थीहरूलाई चलाख र चाखलाग्दो हुन प्रेरणा प्रदान गर्छ (Toto, 2004)। ब्लगिङ एउटा उपकरण हो जसले सहयोगलाई प्रोत्साहित गर्दछ र विद्यार्थीहरूलाई परम्परागत विद्यालय दिनभन्दा पनि राम्रो शिक्षा विस्तार गर्न प्रोत्साहित गर्दछ। ब्लगको उचित उपयोगले “विद्यार्थीहरूलाई थप विश्लेषणात्मक र आलोचनात्मक बन्न सशक्त गर्दछ; इन्टरनेट सामग्रीहरूलाई सक्रिय रूपमा जवाफ दिएर, विद्यार्थीहरूले अरूको लेखनको सन्दर्भमा आफ्नो स्थिति परिभाषित गर्न सक्दछन् र साथै विशेष विषयहरूमा उनीहरूको आफ्नै दृष्टिकोणको रूपरेखा बनाउन सक्छन्” (ओराभेक, 2002)।
mt: Student writing blogs also help to improve. When a student starts a blog with poor grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience usually corrects this. Students usually have the most important audience, so the blogger will try to improve their writing from criticism. Also, blogging “brings students into contact with the world around them.” The desire to be heard by an audience motivates students to be more intelligent and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that encourages collaboration and motivates students to extend their learning beyond the traditional classroom. The proper use of blogs “helps students to become more analytical and critical; they respond actively to Internet materials, students can define their position in relation to the writings of others, and they can outline their own perspective on specific topics” (O’Reilly, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: अतुल्यकालिक सञ्चारले अन्यमा प्रतिबिम्बित र प्रतिक्रियाका लागि समयलाई हौसला दिन्छ। आफ्नै वेगमा काम गर्न यसले विद्यार्थी र निर्देशकीय जानकारीको गति नियन्त्रण गर्न अनुमति दिन्छ। यसका साथै, त्यहाँको लचिलो काम गर्ने समयको सम्भावनामा थोरै समयका प्रतिबन्धहरू रहेका छन्। (ब्रेमर, 1998) इन्टरनेट र वर्ल्ड वाइड वेबको प्रयोगबाट सिक्नेहरूलाई यसले हर समय जानकारीको पहुँच गर्न अनुमति दिन्छ। दिनको कुनै पनि समयमा प्रशिक्षकहरूमा विद्यार्थीहरूले प्रश्न सोध्न सक्छन्। अर्को आमने सामने बैठक सम्म पर्खेर बस्नु भन्दा व्यावहारिक रूपमा द्रुत प्रतिक्रियाको अपेक्षा गर्न सक्छन्।
mt: Asynchronous communication reflects and responds to the pace of the learner and the instructor. There are few restrictions on the amount of work that can be done in a given amount of time. (Bramer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web gives learners access to information at any time. Learners can ask instructors questions at any time. They can respond to questions more practically and quickly than they can in a face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. src: परम्परागत मध्ययुगीन महलले कल्पना, जादूमय घोडा चढेको प्रतिमा, भोज र आर्थरको पालाको शिष्टताको चित्रहरूलाई लामो समयदेखि प्रेरित गरिरहेको छ। हजार वर्ष पुरानो भग्नावशेषहरूको बिचमा खडा भए पनि धेरै पहिले भएका लडाईहरूको आवाज र गन्धहरू, झन्डै ढुङ्गाहरूमा खुरहरूको आवाज सुन्न र कालको खाडलबाट उठ्ने डरको गन्ध लिएको कुरा सम्झन सजिलो छ। तर के हाम्रो कल्पना यथार्थमा आधारित रहेको छ? महलहरू किन पहिलो ठाउँमा बनाइयो? तिनीहरूको कसरी डिजाईन गरियो र निर्माण गरियो?
mt: For centuries, medieval castles have inspired the imagination, the chivalric knight, the horse-mounted statue, the banquet and the court of King Arthur. Standing amidst the ruins of a thousand years, it is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of past battles, the sound of hooves on stone and the smell of fear rising from the depths of the moat. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. src: त्यस अवधिका लागि विशिष्ट, किर्बी मक्सलोई गढ एक साँचो गढभन्दा बढीको किल्ला घर हो। यसका विशाल चमकदार झ्याल र पातलो पर्खालहरू लामो समयसम्म निर्धारित आक्रमणको प्रतिरोध गर्न सक्षम थिएनन्। 1480 को दशकमा, जब लर्ड हेस्टिङ्सद्वारा यसको निर्माण सुरु भयो, तब देश अपेक्षाकृत रूपमा शान्तिमय थियो र घुमन्ते लुटेराहरूका साना झुन्डहरू विरूद्ध मात्र प्रतिरक्षाको आवश्यकता थियो।
mt: For a time, Kirby Muxloe was a castle home to a larger castle. Its large glittering battlements and thin parapets were not able to withstand a long determined attack. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began its construction, the country was relatively peaceful and only small bands of wandering thieves needed to be defended against.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: एक चौथाइ माइलको दौडबाट आधा माइलको दौडमा परिवर्तन हुँदा दौडने गति त्यति धेरै महत्त्वपूर्ण हुँदैन र धैर्यता अत्यन्तै महत्त्वपूर्ण हुन्छ। अवश्य पनि एक प्रथम श्रेणीको आधा-माइल, एक मानिस जसले दुई मिनेटमा पूरा गर्न सक्छ, उसमा उचित गतिको मात्राको हुनु पर्छ, तर धैर्यताका सबै खतराहरूमा शोधन गरिनु पर्छ। शरीरको माथिल्लो भागको लागि व्यायामको साथ संयुक्त, जाडोको समयमा हुने केही क्रस कन्ट्री दौड दौड सिजनका लागि उत्तम तयारी हो।
mt: 1/4 mile run to a 1/2 mile run is not as important as endurance. However, a first class half-mile, a man who can do it in two minutes, should have the proper amount of speed, but all the dangers of endurance should be trained. A combined upper body exercise with some cross country run in cold weather is a good preparation for a cross country season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: उचित पौष्टिक अभ्यासहरूले उत्कृष्ट कार्यप्रदर्शन प्रदान गर्न मात्र हैन, बरू तिनीहरूले उल्लेखनीय रूपमा युवा एथलेटहरूको समग्र तन्दुरुस्तीलाई पनि प्रभाव पार्न सक्छन्। स्वस्थ उर्जा सन्तुलन कायम राख्ने, प्रभावकारी जलयोजनको बानी अभ्यास गर्ने र पूरक अभ्यासका विभिन्न पक्षहरूको बोधले खेलाडीहरूलाई उनीहरूको प्रदर्शन सुधार गर्न र खेलको आनन्द बढाउन मद्दत गर्न सक्छ।
mt: Proper nutrition practices not only provide superior performance, but also significantly improve the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, effective hydration practices, and an understanding of the various aspects of supplemental training can help athletes improve their performance and increase the enjoyment of the game.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: उचित पौष्टिक अभ्यासहरूले उत्कृष्ट कार्यप्रदर्शन प्रदान गर्न मात्र हैन, बरू तिनीहरूले उल्लेखनीय रूपमा युवा एथलेटहरूको समग्र तन्दुरुस्तीलाई पनि प्रभाव पार्न सक्छन्। स्वस्थ उर्जा सन्तुलन कायम राख्ने, प्रभावकारी जलयोजनको बानी अभ्यास गर्ने र पूरक अभ्यासका विभिन्न पक्षहरूको बोधले खेलाडीहरूलाई उनीहरूको प्रदर्शन सुधार गर्न र खेलको आनन्द बढाउन मद्दत गर्न सक्छ।

src: मध्य दूरी दौड अपेक्षाकृत रूपमा सस्तो खेल हो। त्यहाँ भाग लिन आवश्यक सामग्रीका बारेमा धेरैको गलत धारणा छ। उत्पादनहरू आवश्यकताअनुसार किन्न सकिन्छ, तर धेरैजसोको प्रदर्शनमा थोरै वा केही वास्तविक प्रभाव हुनेछैन। खेलाडीहरूले उत्पादनले कुनै वास्तविक लाभ प्रदान नगर्दा पनि उनीहरूले यसलाई नै प्राथमिकता दिन्छन् भन्ने कुरा महसुस गर्न सक्दछन्।
mt: The middle distance run is relatively cheap sport. There is a lot of misconception about the required equipment. The products can be bought as needed, but there will be little or no real effect in most displays. Athletes can feel that they are prioritizing the product even if it does not provide any real benefit.

src: MRI आणविक चुम्बकीय अनुनाद (NMR) भन्ने भौतिक विज्ञान घटनामा आधारित छ, जुन 1930 को दशकमा Felix Bloch (स्ट्यानफोर्ड विश्वविद्यालयमा कार्यरत) र Edward Purcell (हार्वर्ड विश्वविद्यालयबाट) द्वारा पत्ता लगाइएको थियो। यस अनुनादमा, चुम्बकीय क्षेत्र र रेडियो तरङ्गहरूले परमाणुहरूलाई साना रेडियो सङ्केतहरू निकाल्ने बनाउँछन्। सन् 1970 मा, रेमण्ड डामाडियन, एकजना चिकित्सा डाक्टर र अनुसन्धान वैज्ञानिकले चिकित्सकिय रोग पत्ता लगाउनको लागि उपकरणको रूपमा चुम्बकीय प्रतिध्वनीबाट हेर्ने इमेजिङ प्रयोग गर्ने आधार पत्ता लगाए। चार वर्षपछि पेटेन्ट प्रदान गरियो, जुन MRI का क्षेत्रमा जारी गरिएको विश्वको पहिलो पेटेन्ट थियो। सन् 1977 मा, डा. दामादियनले पहिलो “सम्पूर्ण-शरीर” MRI स्क्यानरको निर्माण पूरा गरे, जसलाई उनले “इन्डोमिटेबल” भने।
mt: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is based on physical phenomenon discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (at Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic fields and radio waves cause nuclei to emit small radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, proposed using magnetic resonance from imaging to detect medical conditions. Four years later, a patent was granted, the first patent in the world for the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first "whole-body" MRI scanner, which he called "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: मानवहरू अरूको दिमाग पढ्ने कुरामा सबै जीवहरूभन्दा प्रतिभाशाली छन्। यसको मतलब हामी सफलतापूर्वक भविष्यवाणी गर्न सक्षम छौँ जे अरू मानिसहरूले अनुभव गर्छन्, प्रयोजन राख्छन्, विश्वास गर्छन्, जान्छन् वा इच्छा गर्दछन्। अरूको मनसाय बुझ्नु यी क्षमतामध्ये महत्त्वपूर्ण छ। हामीलाई शारीरिक कार्यहरूको सम्भावित अस्पष्टतामा यसले समाधान गर्न अनुमति दिन्छ। उदाहरणका लागि, यदि तपाईंले कसैलाई कारको झ्याल फुटाएको देख्नु भएको छ भने, तपाईं सायद सोच्नुहुन्छ कि उसले एक अपरिचित व्यक्तिको कार चोर्न कोसिस गरिरहेको थियो। यदि उनले आफ्नो कारको साँचो हराएको हो भने र यो उनले फुटाएर भित्र छिर्न खोजेको आफ्नै कार हो भने, उनलाई अर्कै तरिकाले न्याय गर्न आवश्यक रहेको छ।
mt: Humans are the most intelligent of all animals. This means we can successfully predict what others experience, intend, believe, know, or desire. Understanding the minds of others is one of these abilities. It allows us to solve ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you see someone break a car window, you might think that he was trying to steal a car from an unknown person. If he broke his own car window and was trying to get inside, you would need to punish him in a different way.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: द्यपि AI मा साइन्स फिक्सनको एक मजबुत अर्थ छ, AI ले कम्प्युटर विज्ञानको एक महत्त्वपूर्ण शाखा निर्माण गर्दछ, जसले मेसिनमा व्यवहार, सिकाइ र बुद्धिमत्तापूर्ण अनुकूलनसँग सम्बन्ध राख्दछ। AI मा अनुसन्धानले कार्यहरू स्वचालित गर्न मेसिनहरू बनाउने समावेश गर्छ जसलाई बौद्धिक व्यवहार आवश्यक पर्छ। उदाहरणहरूमा नियन्त्रण, योजना र अनुसूची बनाउने, ग्राहक निदान र प्रश्नहरूको उत्तर दिने क्षमता, साथसाथै हस्तलेखन पहिचान, स्वर र अनुहार समावेश छन्। वास्तविक जीवनका समस्याहरूको समाधान प्रदान गर्ने कुरामा केन्द्रित हुनाले यस्ता कुरा अलग विषय हुन्‌। एआई सिस्टम अहिले प्राय: अर्थशास्त्र, चिकित्सा, इन्जिनियरिङ र सेनाको क्षेत्रमा प्रयोग गरिन्छ, जस्तो कि विभिन्न होम कम्प्युटर र भिडियो गेम सफ्टवेयर एप्लिकेसनहरूमा निर्माण गरिएको छ।
mt: In AI, a strong sense of science fiction is that AI builds a major branch of computer science that deals with behavior, learning, and intelligent adaptation. src: पुरातनबादी सोचाइ ढाँचा समस्या समाधान गर्ने प्रविधिहरू हुन् जुन समाधान फेला पार्न विभिन्न विचारहरू वा क्षेत्रहरूलाई एकताबद्ध गर्छ। यो मानसिकताको जोड भनेको गति, तर्क र शुद्धता साथै तथ्यहरूको पहिचान अवस्थित तरिकाहरूको पुनः प्रयोग जानकारी सङ्कलन हो। यस अइमानसिकताको सबैभन्दा महत्त्वपूर्ण कारक: त्यहाँ केबल एउटा सही जवाफ छ। तपाईं दुई जवाफहरू मात्र सोच्नु हुन्छ, जस्को अर्थ सही वा गलत। केहि विज्ञान वा मानक प्रक्रियासँग यस प्रकारको सोच सम्बन्धित छ। यस प्रकारका सोच भएका मानिसहरूको तार्किक सोच हुन्छ, ढाँचाहरू सम्झन सक्षम हुन्छन्, समस्याहरू समाधान गर्छन् र वैज्ञानिक परीक्षणहरूमा काम गर्छन्।
mt: 1. The ancient way of thinking is a set of problem-solving techniques that bring together various ideas or fields. The most important factor of this mindset: there is only one right answer. You only need to think of two answers, which means right or wrong. This kind of thinking is related to science or standard procedures. People with this kind of thinking have logical thinking, can remember structures, solve problems, and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: अनुहारका चालहरू केहि मिलिसेकेन्डसम्म रहन्छन् भनेर माइक्रो अभिव्यक्तिको व्याख्यामा भिडियो रेकर्डिङको प्रयोगले महत्त्वपूर्ण आविष्कारले देखाएको छ। विशेष रूपमा, एकजना व्यक्तिले सूक्ष्म अभिव्यक्तिको सही व्याख्या गरेर एकजना व्यक्ति झूटो बोलिरहेको छ कि छैन भनेर पत्ता लगाउन सक्छ भनेर दावी गरिएको छ। ओलिभर स्याक्सले, आफ्नो पेपरमा राष्ट्रपतिको भाषणमा, मस्तिष्क क्षतिको कारण बोली बुझ्न असमर्थ व्यक्तिले यथार्थताका साथ सही मूल्याङ्कन गर्न कसरी सक्षम हुन्छन् भनेर सङ्केत गरे। उनले यो समेत सुझाव दिए कि मानव व्यवहार व्याख्या गर्ने यस्ता क्षमताहरू घरपालुवा कुकुर जस्ता जनावरद्वारा साझा गरिन सक्छ।
mt: A new invention using video recordings of micro-expressions has shown that people can accurately identify whether someone is lying or not by reading the correct interpretation of micro-expressions. In particular, one person can tell whether someone is telling the truth or not by reading the true interpretation of someone who is unable to understand speech due to brain damage. Oliver Sacks, in his paper, suggested that such capabilities to interpret human behavior can be shared by domestic dogs such as the family dog.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: अनुहारका चालहरू केहि मिलिसेकेन्डसम्म रहन्छन् भनेर माइक्रो अभिव्यक्तिको व्याख्यामा भिडियो रेकर्डिङको प्रयोगले महत्त्वपूर्ण आविष्कारले देखाएको छ। विशेष रूपमा, एकजना व्यक्तिले सूक्ष्म अभिव्यक्तिको सही व्याख्या गरेर एकजना व्यक्ति झूटो बोलिरहेको छ कि छैन भनेर पत्ता लगाउन सक्छ भनेर दावी गरिएको छ। ओलिभर स्याक्सले, आफ्नो पेपरमा राष्ट्रपतिको भाषणमा, मस्तिष्क क्षतिको कारण बोली बुझ्न असमर्थ व्यक्तिले यथार्थताका साथ सही मूल्याङ्कन गर्न कसरी सक्षम हुन्छन् भनेर सङ्केत गरे। उनले यो समेत सुझाव दिए कि मानव व्यवहार व्याख्या गर्ने यस्ता क्षमताहरू घरपालुवा कुकुर जस्ता जनावरद्वारा साझा गरिन सक्छ।

src: ज्ञान प्राप्त गर्ने र सिक्ने क्षमतामाथि उल्लेख गरिएको अनुसारको तरिकाले परिवर्तन भएको कारणले ज्ञान प्राप्त गरिने आधार दर परिवर्तन भयो। जानकारी प्राप्त गर्ने दृष्टिकोण फरक थियो। अब व्यक्तिगत सम्झनाभित्र कुनै दबाव थिएन, तर पाठलाई सम्झने क्षमता धेरै केन्द्रीकरणको भयो। सारमा, पुनरुत्थानले सिकाइको दृष्टिकोण र ज्ञानको प्रचारमा उल्लेखनीय परिवर्तन गरेको छ।
mt: The cited reason for the change in the way knowledge is gained and learned is the way knowledge is gained. The way information is gained was different. There was no pressure in the memory, but the ability to remember the text was very centralized. In addition, the resurrection has made a significant change in the way of learning and the promotion of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: ज्ञान प्राप्त गर्ने र सिक्ने क्षमतामाथि उल्लेख गरिएको अनुसारको तरिकाले परिवर्तन भएको कारणले ज्ञान प्राप्त गरिने आधार दर परिवर्तन भयो। जानकारी प्राप्त गर्ने दृष्टिकोण फरक थियो। अब व्यक्तिगत सम्झनाभित्र कुनै दबाव थिएन, तर पाठलाई सम्झने क्षमता धेरै केन्द्रीकरणको भयो। सारमा, पुनरुत्थानले सिकाइको दृष्टिकोण र ज्ञानको प्रचारमा उल्लेखनीय परिवर्तन गरेको छ।

src: इन्टरनेटले दुवै सामूहिक र पारस्परिक सञ्चारका तत्त्वहरूलाई जोड्दछ। इन्टरनेटको विशिष्ट विशेषताहरूले उपयोग र तृप्ति दृष्टिकोणको मामिलामा थप पक्षहरू ल्याउनेछ। उदाहरणका लागि, “शिक्षण” र “समाजीकरण”लाई इन्टरनेट उपयोगका लागि महत्त्वपूर्ण प्रेरणाको रूपमा सुझाव गरिएको छ (जेम्स एट अल, 1995)। व्यक्तिगत संलग्नता र “जारी सम्बन्धहरू”लाई Eighmey and McCord (1998) द्वारा नयाँ प्रेरणा पक्षहरूको रूपमा पनि पहिचान गरियो जब तिनीहरूले वेबसाइटहरूमा श्रोताका प्रतिक्रियाहरू अनुसन्धान गरे।
mt: The Internet connects both collective and individual aspects of communication. The unique characteristics of the Internet will bring new perspectives to the use and gratification approach. For example, "education" and "socialization" have been suggested as important motivators for Internet use (James et al., 1995). Personal involvement and "ongoing relationships" were also identified as new motivational perspectives by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they analyzed responses to Web sites.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: इन्टरनेटले दुवै सामूहिक र पारस्परिक सञ्चारका तत्त्वहरूलाई जोड्दछ। इन्टरनेटको विशिष्ट विशेषताहरूले उपयोग र तृप्ति दृष्टिकोणको मामिलामा थप पक्षहरू ल्याउनेछ। उदाहरणका लागि, “शिक्षण” र “समाजीकरण”लाई इन्टरनेट उपयोगका लागि महत्त्वपूर्ण प्रेरणाको रूपमा सुझाव गरिएको छ (जेम्स एट अल, 1995)। व्यक्तिगत संलग्नता र “जारी सम्बन्धहरू”लाई Eighmey and McCord (1998) द्वारा नयाँ प्रेरणा पक्षहरूको रूपमा पनि पहिचान गरियो जब तिनीहरूले वेबसाइटहरूमा श्रोताका प्रतिक्रियाहरू अनुसन्धान गरे।

src: गोथिक शैली 10 औं - 11 औं शताब्दीहरू र 14 औं शताब्दीको बीचको अवधिमा शिखरमा पुग्यो। पूर्वमा बाइजान्टिन संस्कृतिबाट पोशाक धेरै प्रभावित थियो। यद्यपि, संचार च्यानलहरू ढिला हुनाले, पश्चिममा शैलीहरू 25 देखि 30 वर्ष पछि रहन सक्दछन्। मध्य युगको अन्त्यतिर पश्चिमी यूरोपले आफ्नै शैली विकास गर्न थालेको थियो। धर्मयुद्धको परिणामस्वरूप मानिसहरूले त्यस समय विकास गरेका सबैभन्दा महत्त्वपूर्ण कुरामध्ये एउटा कुरा भनेको कपडा बाँध्न बटनहरूको प्रयोग गर्नु थियो।
mt: 10th-11th and 14th centuries Gothic style reached its peak. It was influenced by Byzantine clothing. However, slow communication channels, Western styles can remain for 25 to 30 years. In the late Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the most important things that people developed at that time was the use of buttons to tie clothes.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: गोथिक शैली 10 औं - 11 औं शताब्दीहरू र 14 औं शताब्दीको बीचको अवधिमा शिखरमा पुग्यो। पूर्वमा बाइजान्टिन संस्कृतिबाट पोशाक धेरै प्रभावित थियो। यद्यपि, संचार च्यानलहरू ढिला हुनाले, पश्चिममा शैलीहरू 25 देखि 30 वर्ष पछि रहन सक्दछन्। मध्य युगको अन्त्यतिर पश्चिमी यूरोपले आफ्नै शैली विकास गर्न थालेको थियो। धर्मयुद्धको परिणामस्वरूप मानिसहरूले त्यस समय विकास गरेका सबैभन्दा महत्त्वपूर्ण कुरामध्ये एउटा कुरा भनेको कपडा बाँध्न बटनहरूको प्रयोग गर्नु थियो।

However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: हामी वातावरणमा थप मैत्रीपूर्ण तरिकाले बाँच्न सुरु गर्न सक्छौँ, हामी वातावरणीय आन्दोलनमा सामेल हुन सक्छौँ र हामी भविष्यका पीडाहरूलाई केही हदसम्म कम गर्न कार्यकर्ताहरू समेत बन्न सक्छौँ। यो धेरै अवस्थाहरूमा लक्षण भएको उपचार जस्तै हो। यद्यपि, यदि हामी अस्थायी समाधान मात्र चाहँदैनौँ भने हामीले समस्याहरूको जड पत्ता लगाउनुपर्दछ र हामीले तिनीहरूलाई निष्क्रिय पार्नुपर्दछ। विश्व मानवजातिको वैज्ञानिक र प्राविधिक प्रगतिहरूका कारणले गर्दा धेरै परिवर्तन भएको छ। थप जनसङ्ख्या र मानवजातीका असाधारण जीवनशैलीका कारण समस्याहरू बढी भएका छन् भन्ने स्पष्ट छ।
mt: We can start living more sustainably in the environment, we can join the environmental movement, we can even become activists who can reduce the suffering of future generations by some degree. This is like treating a disease with a temporary solution. However, if we do not want to solve the root causes of the problems, we need to identify them and neutralize them. It is clear that many changes have occurred due to the scientific and technological progress of the world human race. The problems have increased due to the increase in population and the extraordinary lifestyle of the human race.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: हामी वातावरणमा थप मैत्रीपूर्ण तरिकाले बाँच्न सुरु गर्न सक्छौँ, हामी वातावरणीय आन्दोलनमा सामेल हुन सक्छौँ र हामी भविष्यका पीडाहरूलाई केही हदसम्म कम गर्न कार्यकर्ताहरू समेत बन्न सक्छौँ। यो धेरै अवस्थाहरूमा लक्षण भएको उपचार जस्तै हो। यद्यपि, यदि हामी अस्थायी समाधान मात्र चाहँदैनौँ भने हामीले समस्याहरूको जड पत्ता लगाउनुपर्दछ र हामीले तिनीहरूलाई निष्क्रिय पार्नुपर्दछ। विश्व मानवजातिको वैज्ञानिक र प्राविधिक प्रगतिहरूका कारणले गर्दा धेरै परिवर्तन भएको छ। थप जनसङ्ख्या र मानवजातीका असाधारण जीवनशैलीका कारण समस्याहरू बढी भएका छन् भन्ने स्पष्ट छ।
mt: We can start living more sustainably in the environment, we can join the environmental movement, we can even become activists who can reduce the suffering of future generations by some degree. This is like treating a disease with a temporary solution. However, if we do not want to solve the root causes of the problems, we need to identify them and neutralize them. It is clear that many changes have occurred due to the scientific and technological progress of the world human race. The problems have increased due to the increase in population and the extraordinary lifestyle of the human race.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: शक्तिको सन्तुलन एउटा प्रणाली थियो जसमा युरोपेली राष्ट्रहरूले सबै युरोपेली राज्यहरूको राष्ट्रिय सार्वभौमिकता कायम गर्न खोजे। सबै युरोपेली देशहरूले एक राष्ट्रलाई शक्तिशाली बन्नबाट रोक्न खोजी गर्नु अवधारणा थियो र तसर्थ राष्ट्रिय सरकारहरूले सन्तुलन बनाइ राख्नका लागि अक्सर आफ्ना गठबन्धनलाई परिवर्तन गरे। केन्द्रीय मुद्दा शक्ति सन्तुलन भएको स्पेनिस उत्तराधिकारको युद्ध पहिलो युद्धका रूपमा लिइयो। युरोपेली शक्तिहरूसँग अब धार्मिक युद्धहरू हुनुको बहाना नभए सँगै , यसलाई महत्त्वपूर्ण परिवर्तनको रूपमा चिन्हित गर्न सकिन्छ। यसर्थ, तीस वर्षको युद्ध अन्तिम धार्मिक युद्धको रूपमा अङ्कित हुनेछ।
mt: The balance of power was a system in which European states sought to prevent any one state from becoming too powerful. National governments often changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The central issue of the Spanish Succession War is considered the first of the religious wars. With no religious wars now, this can be seen as a major change. Thus, the thirty-year war will be the last of the religious wars.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: युरोपियाली इतिहासको यो अवधिमा, क्याथोलिक चर्च, जो समृद्ध र शक्तिशाली बनेको थियो, छानबिनको दायरामा आयो। हजारौं वर्षदेखि भाषा र रीतिहरूमा भिन्नता भएतापनि इसाई धर्मले युरोपेली राज्यहरूलाई एकसाथ बाँधेको थियो। यसको सर्वव्यापी शक्तिले राजादेखि लिएर सर्वसाधारण सबैलाई प्रभावित पार्‍यो। इसाईको मुख्य सिद्धान्तहरूमध्ये एउटा यो हो कि दुःख र गरीबी हटाउन धनलाई प्रयोग गर्नुपर्दछ र चर्चको मौद्रिक कोष विशेषगरी यसै कारणले हुने गर्दछ। एक हजार बर्षभन्दा भन्दा बढी देखि नै चर्चको केन्द्रीय अधिकार रोममा रहेको थियो र शक्ति र पैसाको एकिकरणले गर्दा धेरैलाई यो प्रश्न गर्न उक्सायो कि के यदि यो सिद्धान्त पूरा भइरहेको छ।
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For thousands of years, despite differences in language and custom, Christianity had bound European states together. Its pervasive power had affected everyone from the king to the common man. One of the main tenets of Christianity is that wealth is to be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and the Church's financial coffers, especially for this reason, have grown. For over a thousand years, the central authority of the Church had been in Rome, and the unification of power and money had led many to ask the question, "If this tenet is being fulfilled, why is there so much suffering and poverty?"
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: 6 अक्टोबर 1789 मा बजारका आईमाईहरूका भीडले त्रसित राजा Louis चौधौं, रानी Marie Antoinette उनिहरूका आफ्ना दुई साना बच्चाहरू (11 बर्षे Marie Therese र चार वर्षको Louis-Charles) र राजाकी बहिनी, Madam Elizabethलाई वर्साइल्सबाट पेरिसतर्फ जबरजस्ती जान बाध्य गरे। एउटा गाडीमा राजा र रानीका बिरूद्ध धम्की दिँदै चिच्याउँदै र कराउँदै गरिरहेका मानिसहरूको भीडले घेरिएर तिनीहरू पेरिस फर्के। जहाँ मानिसहरूको भिडले राजा र रानीका गाडीहरूका झ्यालहरू खुला राख्न बाध्य तुल्याए। एक ठाउँमा भिडका एक सदस्यले भयवित रानीको अगाडि भर्सेलसमा मारिएका एक शाही सुरक्षाकर्मीको टाउको पनि हल्लायो।
mt: 6 October 1789, the mob of the National Assembly forced a distressed King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (11-year-old Marie Therese and 4-year-old Louis-Charles) and King's sister, Madame Elizabeth, from Versailles to Paris. A mob of people who were cursing and shouting at the king and queen in a carriage, surrounded them and forced them to Paris. Where the mob of people forced the king and queen's carriage to keep their windows open. At one point, a member of the mob threw the head of a royal guard who was killed in the Versailles massacre in front of the queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: शत्रुता प्रकोप बढ्ने बितिक्कै, ब्रिटेनले जर्मनीको नाभेल नाकाबन्दी सुरु गर्‍यो। महत्त्वपूर्ण सैन्य र नागरिक आपूर्तिहरू बन्द गरेर, यद्यपि यस नाकाबन्दीले विगत दुई शताब्दीका विभिन्न अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय सम्झौताहरूद्वारा लिखित सामान्यतया स्वीकार्य अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय कानुनहरूको उल्लङ्घन गरे तापनि, रणनीति प्रभावकारी साबित भयो बेलायतले कुनै पनि जहाजलाई महासागरको सम्पूर्ण क्षेत्रमा प्रवेश गर्नबाट रोक्न अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय पानीलाई सुरुङ बनायो, जसले गर्दा तटस्थ जहाजहरूलाई समेत खतरा पुर्यायो। यसको कार्यनीतिमा सीमित प्रतिक्रिया भएको हुनाले, जर्मनले यसको प्रतिबन्धित पनडुब्बी युद्धमा त्यस्तै प्रतिक्रियाको अपेक्षा गरेको थियो।
mt: As tensions escalate, Britain imposed a naval blockade of Germany.  By cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, however, this blockade violated the generally accepted international laws written in various international treaties of the past two centuries, though the strategy proved effective in preventing any ship from entering the entire area of the sea, even neutral ships.  The limited response to this policy led Germany to expect a similar response in its submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाभर, लगभग 400,000 मल्टिपल स्क्लेरोसिस (MS) को ज्ञात घटनाहरू छन्, जसले यसलाई युवा र मध्यम उमेरका वयस्कहरूमा स्नायु सम्बन्धित रोगको रूपमा प्रमुख बनाउँछ। केन्द्रीय स्नायु प्रणालीलाई असर गर्ने MS एक रोग हो, जुन मस्तिष्क, मेरुदण्ड र अप्टिक स्नायुबाट बनेको हुन्छ। अनुसन्धानले पुरुषभन्दा महिलाहरूमा दुई गुणा बढी MS हुने सम्भावना हुन्छ भनेर पत्ता लगाएको छ।
mt: 400,000 people in the United States have known cases of multiple sclerosis (MS), making it the leading neurological disease among young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, spinal cord and optic nerves. Research has found that women are twice as likely as men to have MS.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: डिप्रेसन, डर र विनाशकारी बिचको दुखाइमा पीडा र अशक्तताको बिचको सम्बन्ध थियो भनेर अध्ययनले पत्ता लगायो। उदासी र डरका प्रभावहरू नभई केवल विनाशकारी प्रभावहरू नियमित साप्ताहिक संरचित PA सत्रहरूको शर्त थियो। नियमित गतिविधिमा भाग लिइरहेकाहरूलाई पीडाको नकारात्मक धारणाको सर्तमा अधिक समर्थनको आवश्यकता पर्दछ जसको सामान्य शारीरिक गतिविधिले महसुस गर्ने लामो दुखाइ र असुविधाको भिन्नता छुट्याउँदछ।
mt: The study found a relationship between depression, fear and the pain and weakness in the middle. Depression and fear of the effects of the destructive effects of the regular weekly structured PA sessions. Participants in regular activities to feel the negative perception of pain and support the need for the general physical activity to distinguish the long pain and discomfort of the difference.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: तरवारवाजीको आधुनिक खेल विश्वविद्यालयमा अध्ययन गर्ने विद्यार्थीदेखि लिएर पेशेवर र ओलम्पिक प्रतियोगीहरूले धेरै स्तरहरूमा खेल्छन्। खेल मुख्यतया एक ड्वेल प्रारूपमा खेलिन्छ, एक फेन्सरले अर्कोलाई ड्वेल गर्दछ।
mt: From students studying modern swordplay at university to professional and Olympic competitors, many levels of play are practiced. The sport is primarily played in a dueling format, where one fencer duels another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: आन्तरिक विषाक्तता तुरुन्तै स्पष्ट हुँदैन। लक्षणहरू, जस्तै बान्ता पूरै सामान्य हुन्छन् जस्ले गर्दा तत्काल रोग पत्ता लगाउन सकिदैँन। आन्तरिक विषाक्तताको उत्तम सङ्केत औषधीको खुला कन्टेनर वा विषाक्त घरेलु रसायनको उपस्थिति हुन सक्दछ। तोकिएको विषका लागि विशेष प्राथमिक उपचारको निर्देशनहरूका लागि लेबल हेर्नुहोस्‌।
mt: Internal poisoning is not always immediately obvious. Symptoms, such as vomiting, are often normal, so poisoning cannot be diagnosed immediately. The best sign of internal poisoning is the presence of an open container of medication or a toxic household chemical. Check the label for instructions on the specific poison's primary treatment.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: पीडितको जाँच गर्न, तपाईंले पहिले आफ्नो सुरक्षाका लागि स्थलको सर्वेक्षण गर्नुपर्छ। तपाईं उहाँ र कुनै पनि रातो झन्डामा पुग्दा तपाईंले पीडितको स्थिति ख्याल गर्न सक्नुहुन्छ। मद्दत गर्न खोज्दा तपाईंलाई नै चोट लाग्यो भने समस्या झन् थपिन सक्छ।
mt: To check the safety of the site, you should first survey the site for your own safety. You can see the condition of the victim when you approach him or any red flag. If you are looking for help, you may be injured and the problem can be further aggravated.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: पीडितको जाँच गर्न, तपाईंले पहिले आफ्नो सुरक्षाका लागि स्थलको सर्वेक्षण गर्नुपर्छ। तपाईं उहाँ र कुनै पनि रातो झन्डामा पुग्दा तपाईंले पीडितको स्थिति ख्याल गर्न सक्नुहुन्छ। मद्दत गर्न खोज्दा तपाईंलाई नै चोट लाग्यो भने समस्या झन् थपिन सक्छ।

ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: यहाँ धेरै सामाजिक र राजनैतिक प्रभावहरू जस्तै मेट्रिक प्रणालीको प्रयोग, निरङ्कुशताबाट गणतन्त्रको आगमन, राष्ट्रवाद र देश एउटा शासकको मात्र नभई जनताहरूको पनि हो भन्ने विश्वास छन्। क्रान्तिकारी पेशापछि पनि सबै पुरुष आवेदकहरूलाई सबैभन्दा धेरै महत्वाकांक्षी र सफल हुनका लागि खुल्ला थियो। सेनामा पनि यही भइरहेको थियो किनकि सेनाको श्रेणीकरण वर्गमा आधारित भएतापनि, उनीहरू हालमा कइलाबरमा आधारितथिए। अन्य देशका दमनशील मजदूर वर्गका मान्छेहरूलाई पनि आफ्नो क्रान्ति सुरु गर्न फ्रान्सको क्रान्तिले प्रेरित गर्‍यो।
mt: Here are many social and political effects such as the use of the metric system, the arrival of democracy from the absolutism, the belief that the nation is not only the ruler but also the people. After the revolution, all male applicants were considered the most ambitious and successful. The same was true in the army, because the army's classification was based on class, but they were based on the class of the bourgeoisie. The workers of the oppressed classes of other countries were also inspired to start their own revolution by the French Revolution.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: सबैजना समाजमा भाग लिन्छन् र यातायात प्रणालीहरू प्रयोग गर्दछन्। लगभग सबैजनाले यातायात प्रणालीहरूका बारेमा गुनासो गर्दछन्। विकसित देशहरूमा, तपाईं पानीको गुणस्तर वा पुलहरू तल झर्ने जस्ता बारेमा गुनासोहरू विरलै सुन्नुहुन्छ। यातायात प्रणालीले किन त्यस्ता गुनासा उत्पन्न गर्छन्, तिनीहरू दैनिक आधारमा असफल किन हुन्छन्‌? यातायात इन्जिनियर मात्र अयोग्य छन्? वा केही बढी आधारभूत कुरा चलिरहेको छ?
mt: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries, you rarely hear complaints about water quality or bridges collapsing. Why do transportation systems generate such complaints, and why do they fail so often? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: सबैजना समाजमा भाग लिन्छन् र यातायात प्रणालीहरू प्रयोग गर्दछन्। लगभग सबैजनाले यातायात प्रणालीहरूका बारेमा गुनासो गर्दछन्। विकसित देशहरूमा, तपाईं पानीको गुणस्तर वा पुलहरू तल झर्ने जस्ता बारेमा गुनासोहरू विरलै सुन्नुहुन्छ। यातायात प्रणालीले किन त्यस्ता गुनासा उत्पन्न गर्छन्, तिनीहरू दैनिक आधारमा असफल किन हुन्छन्‌? यातायात इन्जिनियर मात्र अयोग्य छन्? वा केही बढी आधारभूत कुरा चलिरहेको छ?

In developed countries, you rarely hear complaints about water quality or bridges collapsing. Why do transportation systems generate such complaints, and why do they fail so often? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: ट्राफिक प्रवाह भनेको व्यक्तिगत ड्राइभर र सवारी साधनको दुई बिन्दुका बीचमा आवागमनको र उनीहरूले एक अर्कासँग गरेको अन्तरक्रियाको अध्ययन हो। ड्राइभरको व्यवहार सय प्रतिशत निश्चितताका साथ भविष्यवाणी गर्न नसकिने हुँदा दुर्भाग्यवश यातायात प्रवाह अध्ययन गाह्रो छ। भाग्यवश, चालकहरू उचित ढंगले एउटै खालको् व्यवहार गर्न खोज्दछन्; यसैले, ट्राफिक स्ट्रिमहरूमा केही व्यावहारिक स्थिरता हुन्छ र गणितिय रूपमा नराम्रोसँग प्रतिनिधित्व गर्न सकिन्छ। ट्राफिक प्रवाहको राम्रो प्रतिनिधित्व गर्न, तीन मुख्य विशेषताहरू बीच सम्बन्ध स्थापित गरिएको छ: (1) प्रवाह, (2) घनत्व, र (3) वेग। यी सम्बन्धहरूले पथ सुविधाहरूको योजना, डिजाइन र सञ्चालनमा मद्दत पुर्‍याउँछन्।
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and their vehicles between two points and their interactions with each other. The behavior of drivers cannot be predicted with certainty, so unfortunately traffic flow studies are difficult. Unfortunately, drivers tend to behave in a similar manner; thus, there is some practical stability in traffic streams and can be represented mathematically not too badly. To represent traffic flow well, three main characteristics are related: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating roadways.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: ट्राफिक प्रवाह भनेको व्यक्तिगत ड्राइभर र सवारी साधनको दुई बिन्दुका बीचमा आवागमनको र उनीहरूले एक अर्कासँग गरेको अन्तरक्रियाको अध्ययन हो। ड्राइभरको व्यवहार सय प्रतिशत निश्चितताका साथ भविष्यवाणी गर्न नसकिने हुँदा दुर्भाग्यवश यातायात प्रवाह अध्ययन गाह्रो छ। भाग्यवश, चालकहरू उचित ढंगले एउटै खालको् व्यवहार गर्न खोज्दछन्; यसैले, ट्राफिक स्ट्रिमहरूमा केही व्यावहारिक स्थिरता हुन्छ र गणितिय रूपमा नराम्रोसँग प्रतिनिधित्व गर्न सकिन्छ। ट्राफिक प्रवाहको राम्रो प्रतिनिधित्व गर्न, तीन मुख्य विशेषताहरू बीच सम्बन्ध स्थापित गरिएको छ: (1) प्रवाह, (2) घनत्व, र (3) वेग। यी सम्बन्धहरूले पथ सुविधाहरूको योजना, डिजाइन र सञ्चालनमा मद्दत पुर्‍याउँछन्।

src: डीएनए आनुवंशिक सामग्री थियो भनेर Hershey र Chase प्रयोग अग्रणी सुझाव थिए। ब्याक्टेरियममा आफ्नै DNA प्रत्यारोपण गर्न हर्से र चेजले फागेस वा भाइरस प्रयोग गर्थे। उनीहरूले रेडियोएक्टिभ फस्फोरसका साथ फेजको डिएनए वा रेडियोएक्टिभ सल्फरका साथ फेजको प्रोटिनलाई चिन्ह लगाएर दुईवटा प्रयोगहरू गरे।
mt: Hershey and Chase were the first to suggest that DNA was the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phage or virus to transplant their own DNA into bacteria. They labeled the DNA of phage with radioactive phosphorus or the protein of phage with radioactive sulfur in two experiments.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: उत्परिवर्तनका विभिन्न प्रकारका प्रभावहरू उत्परिवर्तनका प्रकार, प्रभावित आनुवंशिक सामग्रीको टुक्राको महत्त्व र यदि प्रभावित कोषहरू कीटाणु(रेखा कोषहरू हुनुमा भर पर्दछन्। अन्यत्र परिवर्तनले सेल मृत्यु वा क्यान्सर निम्त्याउन सक्ने हुनाले जीवाणु रेखा कोषहरूमा हुने उत्परिवर्तन बच्चालाई दिन सकिन्छ।
mt: The effects of different mutations vary by type of mutation, the importance of the affected genetic segment, and whether affected cells are bacteria (line cells) or cancerous (line cells). Mutations in bacteria can be passed on to children.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: उत्परिवर्तनका विभिन्न प्रकारका प्रभावहरू उत्परिवर्तनका प्रकार, प्रभावित आनुवंशिक सामग्रीको टुक्राको महत्त्व र यदि प्रभावित कोषहरू कीटाणु(रेखा कोषहरू हुनुमा भर पर्दछन्। अन्यत्र परिवर्तनले सेल मृत्यु वा क्यान्सर निम्त्याउन सक्ने हुनाले जीवाणु रेखा कोषहरूमा हुने उत्परिवर्तन बच्चालाई दिन सकिन्छ।

ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: बाख्राहरू लगभग 10,000 वर्ष पहिला इरानको जाग्रोस पहाडमा पालिएको हुन्थ्यो जस्तो देखिन्छ। प्राचीन संस्कृति र जनजातिहरूले दूध, कपाल, मासु र छालाको सजिलो पहुँचका लागि तिनीहरूलाई राख्न सुरु गरे। घरपालुवा बाख्राहरूलाई साधारणतया समूहमा राखिन्थ्यो जसलाई पहाड वा अन्य चरन क्षेत्रहरूमा घुमाइन्थ्यो, जसलाई प्रायः बाख्रा गोठालाहरूद्वारा हेरिन्थ्यो जसमा धेरैजसो बच्चा वा किशोर हुन्थे, ती व्यापक रूपमा गोठाला भनेर चिनिने जस्तै हुन्। समूहमा पाल्ने यी विधिहरू आज पनि प्रयोग गरिन्छन्।
mt: 10,000 years ago, sheep were herded in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, wool, meat and skin. Domesticated sheep were usually kept in flocks that were moved to hills or other grazing land, which were usually tended by broad herders, who were often children or adolescents, who were generally known as herders, as in the flocks. These herding practices are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: गोल्फ एक खेल हो जहाँ खेलाडीहरू बललाई प्वालमा छिराउनका लागि क्लबको प्रयोग गर्छन्। अठार प्वालहरू नियमित चरणमा खेलिन्छन्, जसमा खेलाडीहरू प्राय: पहिलो प्वालबाट सुरु गर्दछन् र अठारौंमा समाप्त हुन्छ। थोरै स्ट्रकहरू लिने र क्लबको लयमा खेल्ने खेलाडीले खेल जित्दै खेल पुरा गर्दछन्। यो खेल घाँसमा खेलिन्छ र प्वालको वरिपरिको घाँस छोटो बनाइन्छ र यसलाई ग्रिन भनिन्छ।
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes on a course. 18 holes are played in a regular round, in which players usually start at the first hole and end at the eighteenth.  A few strokes are taken and a club is played in a rhythm.  This game is played on grass and the grass around the holes is cut short and is called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: विज्ञानको मुख्य लक्ष्य भनेको वैज्ञानिक विधिमार्फत संसारले कसरी काम गर्छ भन्ने पत्ता लगाउनु हो। यो विधि वास्तवमा सबैभन्दा बढी वैज्ञानिक अनुसन्धानको मार्गदर्शन गर्छ। यद्यपि यो एक्लो छैन, परीक्षण (परीक्षण भनेको एक जाँच हो जुन एक वा बढी सम्भावित परिकल्पनाहरू हटाउन प्रयोग गरिन्छ), प्रश्नहरू सोध्नाले र अवलोकन गर्नाले पनि वैज्ञानिक अनुसन्धानलाई मार्गदर्शन गर्दछ।
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works. This is done by formulating a hypothesis, or a testable statement about how the world works, and then testing it by experiment or observation. In practice, this is a process that is refined over time—the only way to be sure that a hypothesis is true is to "prove it false", and science is always open to new evidence being discovered that will prove a previous conclusion false and eventually lead to a new conclusion.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
