src: अन्य हिंसात्मक आँधीबेहरीका तुलनामा तुफानले सानो क्षेत्रमा प्रहार गर्दछ, तर तिनीहरूले आफ्नो मार्गमा आउने सबै चिज नष्ट गर्न सक्दछन्। आँधीबेहरीहरूले रूखहरू उखाल्छन्, भवनहरूबाट बोर्डहरू च्यातिदिन्छन् र कारहरूलाई माथि आकाशमा उडाउँदछन्। सबैभन्दा हिंस्रक दुई प्रतिशत आँधीबेहरीहरू तीन घण्टा भन्दा बढी समयसम्म रहन्छन्। यी राक्षसी आँधीहरूको गती 480 किलोमिटर/घण्टा (133 मिटर/सेकेण्ड; 300 mph) सम्म छ।
mt: Other violent storms may strike a wide area, but they can only destroy what is in their path. Hurricanes tear off roofs, strip trees, and toss cars into the sky. The most violent two percent of hurricanes last for more than three hours. These demonic storms can reach speeds of 480 kilometers per hour (133 meters per second; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: हजारौं वर्षदेखि म्याग्निफिकेसनका मान्छेहरूले लेन्सहरू बनाएर प्रयोग गरिरहेका छन्। यद्यपि, पहिला असल टेलिस्कोपहरू युरोपमा 16 औँ शताब्दीको अन्त्यतिर बनेका थिए। टेलिस्कोपहरूमा टाढाका वस्तुहरू नजिक र ठूलो दुबै देख्नका लागि दुईवटा लेन्सको संयोजन प्रयोग गरियो।
mt: For thousands of years, people have been using lenses to magnify things. However, the first real telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. Telescopes use a combination of two lenses to see distant objects both close and large.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: हजारौं वर्षदेखि म्याग्निफिकेसनका मान्छेहरूले लेन्सहरू बनाएर प्रयोग गरिरहेका छन्। यद्यपि, पहिला असल टेलिस्कोपहरू युरोपमा 16 औँ शताब्दीको अन्त्यतिर बनेका थिए। टेलिस्कोपहरूमा टाढाका वस्तुहरू नजिक र ठूलो दुबै देख्नका लागि दुईवटा लेन्सको संयोजन प्रयोग गरियो।

ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: मोहम्मदमा यस सांसारिक जीवन भन्दा परको बारेमा गहिरो चासो थियो। उनले बारम्बार गुफाको प्रयोग गर्दथे जुन चिन्तनका लागि “नूर” (प्रकाश) को पहाडमा “हिरा” “भनेर चिनिन्थ्यो। जसले मृत्युलाई जित्यो उसले आफैँ गुफा बनायो भन्ने भनाईलेमुहम्मदको आध्यात्मिक झुकावको धेरै ज्वलन्त छवि प्रदान गर्दछ। मक्काको उत्तरमा भएका पहाडहरूमध्ये एक टुप्पोमा अवस्थित, यो गुफा विश्वका बाँकी ठाउँबाट पूर्ण रूपमा अलग छ। वास्तवमा, यदि कसैलाई यो अवस्थित छ भन्ने थाहा भएको भए तापनि फेला पार्न विल्कुलै सजिलो छैन। एकपटक गुफामा छिरेपछि, यो पूरै अलगै छ। माथि भएको स्पष्ट, सुन्दर आकाश र वरपरका धेरै पहाडहरू बाहेक अरू केही पनि देख्न सकिदैन। गुफा भित्रबाट यस संसारलाई थोरै मात्र देख्न वा सुन्न सकिन्छ।
mt: In this world, Muhammad had a deep longing for the hereafter. He often used to retreat to a cave, which was known as "Noor" (light) on the mountain of "Hira". This imagery of Muhammad's spiritual inclination provides many vivid images of his longing for death. Located on one of the mountains north of Makkah, this cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, if anyone knew where it was located, it would be very easy to find. Once inside the cave, it is completely isolated. The clear, beautiful sky and the many mountains around it are the only things that can be seen. From inside the cave, this world can be seen or heard only a little.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: वेगनवेहरू 16 औँ शताब्दीको सुरुमै इङ्ग्ल्यान्डमा निर्माण गरिएका थिए। यद्यपि वेगनवेजमा केवल समानान्तर फ्ल्याकहरू मात्र थिए, तर तिनीहरूले घोडाहरूलाई तान्नका लागि अधिक वेग प्राप्त गर्न र दिनमा थोरै बिग्रेका सडकहरूको तुलनामा ठूलो भारी तान्न अनुमति दिए। पटरिहरू समात्नका लागि क्रस टाइहरू धेरै प्रारम्भमा पेश गरिएका थिए। विस्तारै, तथापि, यो महसुस भयो कि यदि पटरिहरूकामाथि फलामको स्टिप भयो भने अधिक कुशल हुनेछ। यो सामान्य अभ्यास भयो, तर फलामले वाहनहरूको काठका पाङ्ग्राहरूमा बढी टुटफुट गरायो। अन्त्यमा, काठका पाङ्ग्राहरू फलामका पाङ्ग्राहरूद्वारा प्रतिस्थापन गरिएका थिए। 1767 मा, पहिलो पूर्ण-फलामका डण्डीहरू भित्र्याइएको थियो।
mt: 16th century in England, the first wagons had only parallel flukes, but they could pull horses to a greater speed and on roads that were only occasionally plowed compared to the heavy pull of horses on straight roads. Cross ties were introduced to hold the wheels in place. However, it was soon realized that if the flukes were made of iron, it would be more efficient. This became a common practice, but iron flukes were more likely to break the wooden axles of the vehicles. Eventually, the wooden axles were replaced by iron axles. In 1767, the first full iron flukes were introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: रोमान्टिकतावादमा सांस्कृतिक निर्धारणवाद को ठूलो तत्त्व थियो, जुन गोथे, फिच्ट र स्लेगल जस्ता लेखकहरूबाट लिइएको थियो। स्वच्छन्दतावादको सन्दर्भमा, भूगोलले व्यक्तिहरूलाई ढल्कायो र समयको क्रमसँगै भूगोलसँग सम्बन्धित रीति-रिवाज र संस्कृति उत्पन्न भए र यी समाजको स्थानसँग सामञ्जस्य कायम राख्दै, मनोमानी ढंगबाट लागू गरिएका कानूनहरूभन्दा उत्कृष्ट थिए।
mt: 1. Cultural determinism was a major element of romanticism, which was influenced by writers such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. In reference to freedom, geography shaped individuals and over time, geography gave rise to customs and cultures that were in harmony with the place, and laws were applied in a manner that was superior to those of man-made laws.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: प्राविधिक निर्धारण एउटा शब्द हो जसले व्यवहारमा विचारहरूको एउटा फराकिलो दायरा समेट्छ, एक सख्त अर्थमा प्रविधि-प्रेरित वा प्राविधिक जरुरी जुन मानव गन्तव्य प्रविधिमा भएका वैज्ञानिक नियमहरू र तिनीहरूको प्रकटीकरणसँग सम्बद्ध अन्तर्निहित तर्कद्वारा प्रेरित हुन्छ। प्राविधिक निर्धारणवादका धेरैजसो व्याख्याहरूले यी दुईवटा सामान्य विचार साझा गर्छन्: प्रविधिको विकासले आफै सांस्कृतिक वा राजनैतिक प्रभावभन्दा परको मार्ग पछ्याउँछ र परिणामस्वरूप प्रविधिले सामिजिक रूपमा अनुकूलित गर्नुको सट्टामा अन्तर्निहित समाजहरूमा “प्रभाव” पार्छ। उदाहरणका लागि, कसैले मोटर कार सडकको विकासका लागि नेतृत्व गरिरहेको भन्न सक्छन्। यद्यपि, एक राष्ट्रव्यापी सडक सञ्जाल केही कारहरूका लागि मात्र आर्थिक रूपमा व्यवहारिक हुँदैन, त्यसैले कार स्वामित्वको लागत कम गर्न उत्पादनका नयाँ विधिहरूको विकास गरिएको छछ। मास कारको स्वामित्वले पनि सडकमा दुर्घटनाको उच्च घटना निम्त्याउँछ, जसले क्षतिग्रस्त शरीरहरू ठीक गर्नका लागि स्वास्थ्य सेवामा नयाँ तरिकाहरूको आविष्कारतर्फ लैजान्छ।
mt: 1. A term that encompasses a wide range of considerations in practice, a strict sense of technology-driven or technology-based necessary that is related to the scientific rules of human technology and their manifestation by implicit argument. Most definitions of technological determinism share two general ideas: technological development follows its own path, largely independent of cultural or political influence, and as a result, technology has a "impact" on the societies in which it is embedded. For example, one could say that the development of the motor car led to the development of the road system. However, a national road system is not economically viable for only a few cars, so new production techniques have been developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass ownership also increases the incidence of road accidents, which in turn leads to the development of new health care techniques.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: “अप बो” चिन्ह भी जस्तो देखिन्छ र “डाउन बो चिन्ह” फेद नभएको स्टेपल वा वर्ग जस्तो देखिन्छ। माथि मतलब तपाईंले टुप्पाबाट सुरु गर्नुपर्छ र बोलाई धक्का दिनु पर्छ र तल मतलब तपाईंले फ्रगबाट सुरु गर्नुपर्छ (जुन तपाईंको हातले बोलाई समातिरहेको स्थान हो) र बोलाई तान्नुपर्छ। एउटा अप-बोले सामान्यतया मधुरो ध्वनि उत्पन्न गर्छ जबकि डाउन बो बलियो र थप ठाडो हुन्छ। तपाईंको आफ्नै निशानामा कलम चलाउन नहिचकिचाउनुहोस्, तर याद गर्नुहोस् मुद्रित धनुष निशानहरू साङ्गीतिक कारणका लागि हुन्, त्यसैले तिनीहरूलाई सामान्यतः सम्मान गर्नुपर्दछ।
mt: “Up bow” looks like a bow tie and “down bow” looks like a stapled or squared off step.  The up bow means you start from the tip and push the bow down.  The down bow means you start from the frog (the part of the bow your hand is holding) and pull the bow up.  An up bow usually produces a sweet sound while a down bow is louder and more forceful.  Don’t fiddle with your own markings, but remember that printed musical notes are for musical reasons, so they are usually respected.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: अन्य नर बाँदर प्राईमेटहरू जस्तो नभई, होमिनिडहरूले आफ्नो हातहरू तेजले चलाउन वा भार बोक्न वा रूखहरूमा हाम फाल्न प्रयोग गर्दैनन्। चिम्पान्जीको हात र खुट्टा आकार र लम्बाईमा उस्तै हुन्छन्, जसले औँला टेकेर हिँड्दा तौल बोक्नको लागि हातको प्रयोगलाई झल्काउँछन्। हड्डीहरूका साथ मानव हात खुट्टाभन्दा भन्दा छोटो हुन्छ। दुई मिलियन देखि तीन मिलियन वर्ष पुराना जीवाश्म हातका हड्डीहरूले हातको विशेषज्ञता लोकोमोशन देखि म्यानुपुलेशन मा भएको यो बदलावलाई प्रकट गर्दछ।
mt: Unlike other apes, hominids do not use their hands to walk or carry weight or to climb trees. The chimp hand and forearm are the same size, which obscures the use of the hand to carry weight when walking. Human hands are smaller than the forearm. Two to three million year old fossil hand bones show this specialization for locomotion to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: बीसौँ शताब्दीमा गरिएको अनुसन्धानले लुकेको र अभिव्यक्त गरी आनुवांशिक भिन्नताका दुई समूहहरू हुन्छन् भन्ने देखाएको छ। उत्परिवर्तनले नयाँ आनुवंशिक भिन्नता थप्छ र चयनले यसलाई अभिव्यक्त भिन्नताको पुलबाट हटाउँछ। वियोग र पुनसंयोजन दुई पुलहरूको बिच प्रत्येक पुस्ताको साथ अघि र पछि परिवर्तनलाई फेरबदल गर्छ।
mt: 20th century research has shown that there are two groups of mutations: those that add new genetic variation and those that express it. Loss and recombination each move each generation forward and backward between the two groups, swapping mutations back and forth.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: सवाना देखि बाहिर, मानिसको जस्तो पाचन प्रणाली भएको प्राइमेटलाई उपलब्ध वनस्पति स्रोतहरूबाट उसको एमिनो-एसिड आवश्यकताहरू पूरा गर्न गाह्रो छ। यसबाहेक, त्यस्तो गर्न असफल हुँदा गम्भीर परिणामहरू हुन्छन्: मानसिक चिन्तामा वृद्धि, कुपोषण र अन्ततः मृत्यु हुन्छ। पात र फलफूलहरूमा पाइने प्रोटिनहरू सबैभन्दा सजिलो र पहुँचयोग्य वनस्पति स्रोतहरू हुन सक्थे। तर हामी जस्ता नरवानरका लागि यी खानेकुरा नपकाइकन खाँदा पचाउन गाह्रो हुन्छ। यसको विपरित सबै आवश्यक एमिनो एसिडहरू समावेश गर्ने हुनाले जनावरहरूको खाना (कमिला, धमिरा, अन्डा) मात्र सजिलै पचाउन सकिने छैन तर तिनीहरूले उच्च परिमाणको प्रोटिन प्रदान गर्छ। सबै कुरा विचार गर्दा, हाम्रा आफ्नै पुर्खाहरूले केही हदसम्म आज सभानामा चिम्पान्जीहरूले गरेको जस्तै तरिकाले आफ्नो “प्रोटिन समस्या” समाधान गरेको भए हामी अचम्मित हुनुपर्दैन।
mt: From the outside, in, the digestive system of a human is similar to that of a chimpanzee. We share 99% of our DNA with them. But there is one major difference: we can digest the protein in plants, while they cannot. This is because the human digestive system has evolved to break down the cellulose in plants, while the chimpanzee digestive system has not. This is why we can eat a salad, while a chimpanzee cannot. The same is true for all other primates, including gorillas, orangutans, and gibbons. The only exception is the bonobo, which is a type of chimpanzee. The bonobo can digest the protein in plants, but it is not as efficient as the human digestive system. This is because the bonobo digestive system has not evolved to break down the cellulose in plants. ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: सामाजिक स्तरबाट उपेक्षित महसुस गर्न र उनीहरूलाई पहिचानको भावना विकास गर्न अनुमति दिन उपसंस्कृतिले समान विचारधाराका व्यक्तिहरूलाई एक साथ ल्याउँछ। उप-संस्कृतिहरू उमेर, जातीयता, वर्ग, स्थान र/वा सदस्यहरूको लिङ्गको कारण विशिष्ट हुन सक्छ। उप संस्कृतिलाई छुट्ट्याउन सक्ने गुण भाषिक, सौन्दर्य, धार्मिक, राजनीतिक, यौन, भौगोलिक वा कारकहरूको संयोजनका हुन सक्छन्‌। उपसंस्कृतिका सदस्यहरू प्राय: शैलीको विशिष्ट र प्रतिकात्मक प्रयोगको माध्यमबाट तिनीहरूको सदस्यता सङ्केत गर्दछन्, जसमा शैली, तरिका र आर्गट समावेश छ।
mt: 1. Socially marginalized people feel a sense of belonging and develop a sense of identity when they are brought together by subcultures. Subcultures can be specific to age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or the gender of their members. Subcultures can be distinguished by combinations of linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or other factors. Members of subcultures often signal their membership by the distinctive use of style, mannerism, and argot.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: बालबालिकाहरूले सानैमा जाति र जातीय रूढिवादीहरूको सचेतना विकास गर्दछन् र यी जातीय रूढीवादीहरूले व्यवहारलाई असर गर्दछ। उदाहरणका लागि, विद्यालयमा राम्रो नगर्ने रुढीवादी रहेको जातीय अल्पसङ्ख्यकको रूपमा पहिचान भएका बच्चाहरूले आफ्नो जातिसँग सम्बन्धित रुढीवादी बारे एकपटक जानेपछि विस्यालयमा राम्रो नगर्न खोज्छन्।
mt: Children learn to be aware of ethnic and ethnic prejudice and these ethnic prejudices affect behavior. For example, children who are identified as belonging to an ethnic minority that is known to be prejudiced against their own ethnicity will try to do well in school after learning about the prejudices of their own ethnicity once.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: बालबालिकाहरूले सानैमा जाति र जातीय रूढिवादीहरूको सचेतना विकास गर्दछन् र यी जातीय रूढीवादीहरूले व्यवहारलाई असर गर्दछ। उदाहरणका लागि, विद्यालयमा राम्रो नगर्ने रुढीवादी रहेको जातीय अल्पसङ्ख्यकको रूपमा पहिचान भएका बच्चाहरूले आफ्नो जातिसँग सम्बन्धित रुढीवादी बारे एकपटक जानेपछि विस्यालयमा राम्रो नगर्न खोज्छन्।

For example, children who are identified as belonging to an ethnic minority that is known to be prejudiced against their own ethnicity will try to do well in school after learning about the prejudices of their own ethnicity once.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: समाजीकरणको महत्त्वलाई स्पष्ट पार्न प्रयोग गरिने सबैभन्दा सामान्य तरिकाहरूमध्ये एक भनेको बालबालिकाहरू बढ्दै गर्दा वयस्कहरूद्वारा समाजिकृत नभएर उपेक्षा, दुर्भाग्य वा स्वेच्छाचारी दुर्व्यवहारको सामना गरेका बालबालिकाहरूका केही दुर्भाग्यपूर्ण मामलाहरूलाई अंकित गर्नु हो। त्यस्ता बच्चाहरूलाई “असभ्य” वा जङ्गली भनिन्छ। केही असभ्य बच्चाहरू मानिसहरूद्वारा सीमित गरिएका छन् (सामान्यतया उनीहरूका आफ्नै अभिभावकहरू) केही मामीलाहरूमा यो बच्चाको त्याग आमाबुवाहरूको बच्चाको गम्भीर बौद्धिक वा शारीरिक अशक्तताको अस्वीकृतिका कारण थियो। असभ्य बालबालिकाले घर छोड्नु र भाग्नुभन्दा पहिला गम्भीर बाल दुर्व्यवहार वा भौतिक क्षतिको सामना गरेको हुन सक्छ। अरूलाई जनावरले हुर्काएको भन्ने कथन छ; केही आफैं वनमा बसोबास गरेको बताइन्छ। जब पूर्ण रूपमा गैर-मानव जन्तुहरूद्वारा हुर्काइन्छ, जङ्गली बच्चाको व्यवहार (शारीरिक सीमाहरू भित्र) प्रायः पूर्णतया विशेष हेरचाह गर्ने जनावरहरू जस्तै यसको डर वा मानवहरूमा उदासीनता प्रदर्शन गर्दछ।
mt: One of the most common ways of illustrating the importance of socialization is to list some unfortunate cases of children who have been neglected, unfortunate, or abused by adults without socialization. Such children are called "feral" or "wild." Some feral children have been kept by humans (usually their own parents) as pets (usually in a limited way; e.g., they are not allowed to interact with other humans). Some were abandoned by their parents because of their severe mental or physical disabilities. Feral children may have suffered severe child abuse or physical injury before leaving home and going to live in the wild. They are said to have been raised by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild. When fully raised by non-human animals, the behavior (within physical limits) of a feral child is usually like that of animals that are particularly wary of or indifferent to humans.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: जीवन कृषि भनेको कृषक र उसको परिवार मात्रको आवश्यकता पूरा गर्न पर्याप्त खाद्य उत्पादनका लागि गरिने कृषि कार्य हो। निर्वाहमुखी कृषि एक सरल, प्राय: जैवीक, बालीको आलोपालोको साथ पारिस्थितिक युक्त बचत गरिएको देशी बीज प्रयोग गरिने प्रणाली वा अधिकतम उपजको लागि अन्य अपेक्षाकृत सरल प्रविधिहरू हो। ऐतिहासिक रूपमा अधिकांश किसानहरू निर्वाह कृषिमा संलग्न थिए र अझै पनि विकासोन्मुख देशहरूमा यस्तै मामिला रहेको छ।
mt: Life farming is the farming of a farmer and his family to produce enough food for their needs.  Sustainable farming is a simple, mostly organic, low-input, low-output system of farming that uses local, saved seeds with little or no chemical inputs. Historically, most farmers were subsistence farmers and this is still the case in developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: जीवन कृषि भनेको कृषक र उसको परिवार मात्रको आवश्यकता पूरा गर्न पर्याप्त खाद्य उत्पादनका लागि गरिने कृषि कार्य हो। निर्वाहमुखी कृषि एक सरल, प्राय: जैवीक, बालीको आलोपालोको साथ पारिस्थितिक युक्त बचत गरिएको देशी बीज प्रयोग गरिने प्रणाली वा अधिकतम उपजको लागि अन्य अपेक्षाकृत सरल प्रविधिहरू हो। ऐतिहासिक रूपमा अधिकांश किसानहरू निर्वाह कृषिमा संलग्न थिए र अझै पनि विकासोन्मुख देशहरूमा यस्तै मामिला रहेको छ।

src: सम्भवतः सबैभन्दा सामान्य किसिमको पर्यटन त्यो हो जुन प्रायः जसो व्यक्तिहरू यात्रा गर्न रुचाउँछन्ः मनोरञ्जन पर्यटन। कुनै त्यस्तो अवस्थामा व्यक्ति एक स्थानमा जान्छन् जुन आराम लिन र रमाइलोका लागि हुन्छ जुन उनीहरूको नियमित दैनिक जीवनभन्दा भन्दा फरक हुन्छ। समुन्द्री तट, थिम पार्क र क्याम्प मैदानहरू मनोरञ्जन पर्यटकहरूद्वारा बारम्बार भ्रमण गरिने सबैभन्दा साझा ठाउँहरू हुन्। कुनै व्यक्ति कुनै खास ठाउँको भ्रमणको उद्देश्य यसको इतिहास र संस्कृति जान्ने हो भने यस प्रकारको पर्यटनलाई सांस्कृतिक पर्यटन भनेर चिनिन्छ। पर्यटकहरूले कुनै विशेष देशको विभिन्न स्थल भ्रमण गर्न सक्छन् वा तिनीहरूले केवल एउटा क्षेत्रमा ध्यान केन्द्रित गर्ने विकल्प सहजै लिन सक्छन्।
mt: The most common type of tourism is that which people take for pleasure. In this case, a person visits a place for recreation and amusement, which is different from their normal daily life. Beaches, theme parks, and campgrounds are the most common places visited by pleasure tourists. If a person wants to visit a place to learn about its history and culture, this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. Tourists can visit different places in a particular country or they can focus on one area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: धेरै दशकहरूदेखि सम्मिलित भएका व्यक्तिहरूले स्पष्ट रूपमा हाम्रा कठिनाइहरू र असफलताहरूको मूल्याङ्कन गर्दै हामीलाई हाम्रो बल र जोशको कदर गर्न सहयोग गरे। मानिसहरूले उनीहरूको व्यक्तिगत, पारिवारिक, र संगठनात्मक कथाहरू बताउँदा सुन्ने क्रममा, हामीले विगत र संगठनको संस्कृतिलाई राम्रो वा नराम्रो प्रभाव पारेका केही व्यक्तित्वहरूको मूल्यवान अन्तरदृष्टि प्राप्त गर्यौं। कसैको इतिहास बुझ्दा संस्कृति बुझिएको मानिँदैन, यसले कम्तीमा मानिसलाई सङ्गठनको इतिहासभित्र उनीहरू कहाँ चुके भन्ने बोध हासिल गर्न मद्दत गर्छ। सफलताहरू आँकलन गर्दा र असफलताहरूमा सावधान हुँदा, व्यक्तिहरू र सम्पूर्ण सहभागी व्यक्तिहरूले संस्थाको महत्त्व, मिसन र आकर्षक बलहरू अझै गहन तरिकाले पत्ता लगाउँछन्। यस घटनामा, पहिलेका उद्यमशील व्यवहारका उदाहरणहरू र तिनका सफल परिणामहरू स्मरण गर्नाले मानिसहरूलाई नयाँ परिवर्तनप्रति र स्थानीय चर्चका लागि नयाँ निर्देशन प्रति खुला हुन सहयोग पुर्‍यायो। यस्ता सफलताका कथाहरूले भविष्यको परिवर्तनतर्फ सकारात्मक झुकाव सिर्जना गर्दै परिवर्तनको डरलाई कम गराए।
mt: For many decades, people who have been involved have clearly valued our difficulties and failures in assessing our strength and enthusiasm. Hearing people tell their personal, family, and organizational stories, we have gained valuable insights from some individuals who have had a positive or negative impact on our culture and history. Knowing the history of a person does not mean knowing the culture, but it does help to understand where they have been. Assessing successes and being cautious about failures, people and all participants have valued the importance of the organization, its mission, and its attractive forces. In this event, examples of previous entrepreneurial behavior and their successful results helped people to be open to new changes and new directions for local discussions. Such success stories have created a positive tilt towards change and reduced the fear of change.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: सिकाइको पछिल्लो आधुनिक दृष्टिकोणले परमबाट स्वतन्त्रता प्रस्ताव गर्दछ। सिक्नका लागि त्यहाँ एउटा राम्रो तरिका छ। वास्तवमा, त्यहाँ सिक्नका लागि एउटा पनि राम्रो कुरा छैन। सिकाइ सिक्ने र प्रस्तुत गरिएको ज्ञानको बीचको अनुभवमा हुने गर्दछ। हाम्रो हालको अनुभव आफैंले गरेको र आफैंमा जानकारी प्रस्तुत गर्दै, अध्ययन-आधारित टेलिभिजन कार्यक्रमहरूले यस कुरालाई स्पष्ट पार्छ। हामीमध्ये धेरैले आफूलाई त्यो टेलिभिजन शो हेरेको पाउँछौँ जुनले हामी कहिल्यै सहभागी नहुने वा त्यो ज्ञान प्रयोग नगर्ने प्रक्रिया वा अनुभवको जानकारी दिन्छ। हामी कहिल्यै पनि कारलाई पूर्ण रूपमा परिवर्तन गर्नेछैनौँ, हाम्रो घर पछाडि फोहोरा निर्माण गर्नेछैनौँ, पुराना भग्नावशेषहरू जाँच्न पेरु यात्रा गर्नेछैनौँ वा आफ्नो छिमेकीको घर पुनर्निर्माण गर्नेछैनौँ।
mt: The latest approach to learning is to propose independence from authority. There is a good way to learn. In fact, there is no good way to learn. Learning is an experience between what is learned and the presentation of knowledge, based on study. Most of us have watched a television show that tells us about a process or experience that we will never be involved in or use that knowledge. We will never fully change the car, we will not build a fireplace in our house, we will not excavate old ruins in Peru, or we will not rebuild our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. src: निद्रामा हस्तक्षेप भनेको तपाईंको साधारण निद्राको अवधिमा कुनै उद्देश्यले ब्युँझिने र छोटो समय (10 देखि 60 मिनेट) पछि निदाउने प्रक्रिया हो। तपाईंलाई पूर्ण रूपमा नउठाइ तपाईंलाई चेतमा ल्याउन यो सजिलैसँग शान्त अलार्म घडी प्रयोग गर्न सकिन्छ। यदि तपाईंले आफ्नो निद्रामा घडी रिसेट गरिरहेको पाउनुहुन्छ भने, यसलाई कोठाको अर्को पट्टि राख्न सकिन्छ, जसले तपाईंलाई ओछयानबाट बाहिर गएर यसलाई बन्द गर्न बाध्य पार्दछ। अन्य बायोरिदम-आधारित विकल्पहरूमा सुत्नुभन्दा अगाडि धेरै तरल पदार्थ (विशेषगरी पानी वा चिया, पिसाब लगाउने भनेर थाहा भएको) पिउने समावेश गर्दछ, जसले मानिसलाई पिसाब गर्न उठ्न बाध्य पार्छ।
mt: Napping is a brief period of sleep taken during the day. It is a natural part of the sleep cycle, and is often used to restore alertness and energy. A simple way to gently wake someone from a nap is to use a silent alarm clock. If you notice that someone is resetting their alarm clock while they are napping, you can place the clock on a different shelf, forcing them to get up and turn it off. Other biofeedback-based options include drinking a lot of liquid (especially water or tea, known to be consumed before urination) to force someone to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: निद्रामा हस्तक्षेप भनेको तपाईंको साधारण निद्राको अवधिमा कुनै उद्देश्यले ब्युँझिने र छोटो समय (10 देखि 60 मिनेट) पछि निदाउने प्रक्रिया हो। तपाईंलाई पूर्ण रूपमा नउठाइ तपाईंलाई चेतमा ल्याउन यो सजिलैसँग शान्त अलार्म घडी प्रयोग गर्न सकिन्छ। यदि तपाईंले आफ्नो निद्रामा घडी रिसेट गरिरहेको पाउनुहुन्छ भने, यसलाई कोठाको अर्को पट्टि राख्न सकिन्छ, जसले तपाईंलाई ओछयानबाट बाहिर गएर यसलाई बन्द गर्न बाध्य पार्दछ। अन्य बायोरिदम-आधारित विकल्पहरूमा सुत्नुभन्दा अगाडि धेरै तरल पदार्थ (विशेषगरी पानी वा चिया, पिसाब लगाउने भनेर थाहा भएको) पिउने समावेश गर्दछ, जसले मानिसलाई पिसाब गर्न उठ्न बाध्य पार्छ।
mt: Napping is a brief period of sleep taken during the day. It is a natural part of the sleep cycle, and is often used to restore alertness and energy. A simple way to gently wake someone from a nap is to use a silent alarm clock. If you notice that someone is resetting their alarm clock while they are napping, you can place the clock on a different shelf, forcing them to get up and turn it off. Other biofeedback-based options include drinking a lot of liquid (especially water or tea, known to be consumed before urination) to force someone to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: केही मानिसहरू विश्वास गर्दछन् कि धेरै कृत्रिम रूपमा प्रेरित सुन्दर सपनाको अनुभव गर्नु थकाइलाग्दो हुन सक्छ। REM चरणको बिचमा विस्तारित समय अवधिमा देखिने स्पष्ट सपनाको परिणामस्वरूप यो घटना हुने गर्छ । प्रति रात थोरै REM हरूसँग, तपाईंले वास्तविक निन्द्राको अनुभव गर्नुहने र तपाईंको शरीर निको हुने यो अवस्था  मुश्किलले मात्रै समस्या बन्छ। यो तपाईं हरेक बीस वा तीस मिनेटमा उठेर टिभी हेरे जत्तिकै थकाइ लाग्दो हुन्छ। यसको प्रभाव तपाईंको दिमागले प्रति रात राम्रो सपनाका लागि कति प्रयास गर्दछ भन्ने कुरामा निर्भर गर्दछ।
mt: Some people believe that experiencing vivid dreams during the extended REM phase in the middle of the night can be exhausting. With only a few REMs per night, you can experience real sleep deprivation and your body feels tired. This effect is how much effort your brain puts into having good dreams every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: केही मानिसहरू विश्वास गर्दछन् कि धेरै कृत्रिम रूपमा प्रेरित सुन्दर सपनाको अनुभव गर्नु थकाइलाग्दो हुन सक्छ। REM चरणको बिचमा विस्तारित समय अवधिमा देखिने स्पष्ट सपनाको परिणामस्वरूप यो घटना हुने गर्छ । प्रति रात थोरै REM हरूसँग, तपाईंले वास्तविक निन्द्राको अनुभव गर्नुहने र तपाईंको शरीर निको हुने यो अवस्था  मुश्किलले मात्रै समस्या बन्छ। यो तपाईं हरेक बीस वा तीस मिनेटमा उठेर टिभी हेरे जत्तिकै थकाइ लाग्दो हुन्छ। यसको प्रभाव तपाईंको दिमागले प्रति रात राम्रो सपनाका लागि कति प्रयास गर्दछ भन्ने कुरामा निर्भर गर्दछ।
mt: Some people believe that experiencing vivid dreams during the extended REM phase in the middle of the night can be exhausting. With only a few REMs per night, you can experience real sleep deprivation and your body feels tired. This effect is how much effort your brain puts into having good dreams every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: भर्चुअल टोलीहरूलाई परम्परागत टोलीहरूको जस्तै उत्कृष्टताका स्तरहरू भएको रूपमा लिइन्छ, तर त्यहाँ सूक्ष्म भिन्नताहरू छन्। भर्चुअल टोली सदस्यहरूले प्रायः आफ्ना तत्कालिन भौतिक समूहका लागि सम्पर्क विन्दुको रूपमा कार्य गर्दछन्। तिनीहरूसँग प्रायः परम्परागत टोली सदस्यहरू भन्दा बढी स्वतन्त्रता हुन्छ किनकि तिनीहरूका टोलीहरू फरक समय क्षेत्र अनुसार भेट गर्न सक्छन् जुन उनीहरूको स्थानीय व्यवस्थापनले नबुझ्न सक्छ। साँचो “अदृश्य टीम” (Larson र LaFasto, 1989, p109) को उपस्थिति पनि भर्चुअल टोलीको अद्वितीय अंश हो। “अदृश्य टोली” एक प्रबन्धक टोली हो जसलाई प्रत्येक सदस्यहरूले रिपोर्ट गर्दछन्। अदृश्य टोलीले प्रत्येक सदस्यका लागि मापदण्डहरू तोक्दछ।
mt: Virtual teams are often considered to be as effective as traditional teams, but there are some subtle differences. Virtual team members often act as a contact point for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than traditional team members because their teams can meet at different times zones which their local organization may not understand. The presence of the “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique aspect of virtual teams. The “invisible team” is a management team that each member reports to. The invisible team sets standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: सामग्री सिद्धान्तहरू मानिसहरूलाई छान्न वा तिनीहरूलाई अपील गर्ने सक्ने अवस्थाको खोजमा केन्द्रित हुन्छन्। यी सिद्धान्तहरूले व्यक्तिसँग निश्चित आवश्यकता र/वा चाहनाहरू हुन्छन् जुन उनीहरू वयस्कमा परिपक्व हुँदा आन्तरिकृत भएका छन् भन्ने सुझाव दिन्छ। यी सिद्धान्तहरूले ती कुराहरूमा हेर्छन् जसले निश्चित व्यक्तिहरूले गर्ने काम गर्न चाहने बनाउँछन् र तिनीहरूलाई निश्चित कुराहरू गर्न लगाउने वा नलगाउने तिनीहरूका वातावरणमा भएका निश्चित कुराहरू हेर्छन्। दुई लोकप्रिय सामाग्री सिद्धान्तहरू मास्लोको दर्जाको आवश्यकता सिद्धान्त र हर्ट्जबर्गको दुई कारक सिद्धान्त हुन्।
mt: Theories of motivation focus on the search for what makes people do what they do. These theories suggest that people have certain needs or desires that are internalized as they mature into adults. These theories look at what makes people want to do certain things and what keeps them from doing certain things in their environments. Two popular theories of motivation are Maslow's hierarchy of needs and Herzberg's two-factor theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: तिहाइको धेरै-दुरुपयोग र अक्सर-उपहास गरिएको नियम एक सरल दिशानिर्देश हो जो सिर्जना छविमा क्रमको माप राख्दै गतिशीलता सृजना गर्नु हो। यसले बताउँछ कि मुख्य वस्तुका लागि सबैभन्दा प्रभावकारी स्थान आकृतिलाई ठाडो र तेर्सो तरिकाले तीन भागमा विभाजन गर्ने रेखाहरूको प्रतिच्छेदन स्थानमा हुन्छ (उदाहरण हेर्नुहोस्)।
mt: The rule, often derided and overused in Thailand, is a simple guideline that places the most effective location for the main subject by dividing the image into thirds horizontally and vertically, and placing the intersection of the lines at the point of interest (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: उदाहरणका लागि, संसारमा सबैभन्दा सामान्य स्थिर छवि एनालग फिल्म युगको अन्तमा प्रमुख फिल्म आकार फोटोग्राफी ढाँचा 35मिलिमिटर थियो। यो आज पनि उत्पादन गरिएको छ, तर अझै महत्त्वपूर्ण पक्ष भनेको यसको अनुपात डिजिटल क्यामेरा तस्वीरको सेन्सर ढाँचाद्वारा बनाएको छ। 35 मिलिमिटरको ढाँचा वास्तवमा, केही भ्रामक भए पनि चौडाईमा 36 मिलिमिटर र उचाइमा 24 मिलिमिटरको छ। यस ढाँचाको अनुपात (सबैभन्दा साधारण सम्पूर्ण संख्याको अनुपात प्राप्त गर्न बाह्रलाई विभाजन गरेर ) त्यसैले 3:2 मानिएको छ। धेरैजसो सामान्य ढाँचाहरू (उदाहरणका लागि APS ढाँचा परिवार) यस आकार अनुपातको बराबर वा लगभग निकट हुन्छन्।
mt: For example, the most common aspect ratio of a still image in the world at the end of the analog film era was the standard 35mm film frame, which is still produced, but its aspect ratio is also important, as it was derived from the aspect ratio of the 35mm film frame's sensor format, which is actually 36mm wide and 24mm high. The aspect ratio of this format, therefore, is 3:2. Most common formats (such as the APS family of formats) are close to or equal to this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: जुम लेन्सको खराबी भनेको यसको फोकल लम्बाईको दायरा प्राप्त गर्न आवश्यक फोकल जटिलता हो र लेन्स तत्वहरूको सङ्ख्या प्राइम लेन्सकोभन्दा बढी हुन्छ। लेन्स उत्पादकहरूले लेन्सको उत्पादनमा उच्च गुणस्तर प्राप्त गरेपछि यो समस्या कम हुँदै गइरहेको छ। यसले जुम लेन्सलाई निश्चित फोकल लम्बाइका साथ लेन्सद्वारा प्राप्त तुलनीय गुणस्तरको तस्बिर निकाल्न गर्न अनुमति दिन्छ। लेन्सको अधिकतम एपेचर (गति) प्रायः कम हुने भएर जुम लेन्सको अर्को घाटा हो। यसले बिना फ्ल्याशको कम प्रकाशका अवस्थाहरूमा सस्तो जुम लेन्सहरूको प्रयोग गर्न कठिन बनाउँछ।
mt: The problem with zoom lenses is that their focal length range requires a greater focal complexity than prime lenses. Lens manufacturers have reduced this problem by producing lenses with higher quality in production. This allows zoom lenses to produce images with comparable quality to fixed focal length lenses. The maximum aperture of zoom lenses is usually lower, which makes it difficult to use cheaper zoom lenses without flash in low light situations.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: रहस्यवाद भनेको एक खोज हो संगम साथ, परिचय साथ वा एक परम वास्तविकता, ईश्वरीयता, आध्यात्मिक सत्य वा ईश्वरको सचेत जागरूकत हो। अनुयायीले प्रत्यक्ष अनुभव अन्तर्ज्ञान वा ईश्वरीय वास्तविकता/ईश्वरता वा देवतामा अन्तर्दृष्टिको खोजी गर्छ। अनुयायीहरूले केही तरिकाहरू अनुसरण गर्छन्, जिउने वा ती अभ्यासहरू जुन ती अनुभवहरूलाई पोषण दिनका लागि प्रायोजित छन्। रहस्यवादलाई अन्य धार्मिक मान्यता र आराधनाका विशेषगरी शान्तिमय, अन्तरदृष्टि, परमानंद वा उन्मादपूर्ण चरित्र भएकारूपहरूबाट यसको चेतनाको विशिष्ट अवस्थाको प्रत्यक्ष व्यक्तिगत अनुभवमा जोड दिएर अलग गर्न सकिन्छ,।
mt: Mysticism is a pursuit of direct communion with an ultimate reality, God, or divinity through subjective experience and/or insight. Mysticism usually requires some form of disciplined action, such as meditation or devotion, often in a religious context, and is generally accompanied by cultivation of a particular psychological state, such as a "state of grace" or "cosmic consciousness". Mysticism is often associated with religion, but it is also found in non-religious humanistic contexts.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: रहस्यवाद भनेको एक खोज हो संगम साथ, परिचय साथ वा एक परम वास्तविकता, ईश्वरीयता, आध्यात्मिक सत्य वा ईश्वरको सचेत जागरूकत हो। अनुयायीले प्रत्यक्ष अनुभव अन्तर्ज्ञान वा ईश्वरीय वास्तविकता/ईश्वरता वा देवतामा अन्तर्दृष्टिको खोजी गर्छ। अनुयायीहरूले केही तरिकाहरू अनुसरण गर्छन्, जिउने वा ती अभ्यासहरू जुन ती अनुभवहरूलाई पोषण दिनका लागि प्रायोजित छन्। रहस्यवादलाई अन्य धार्मिक मान्यता र आराधनाका विशेषगरी शान्तिमय, अन्तरदृष्टि, परमानंद वा उन्मादपूर्ण चरित्र भएकारूपहरूबाट यसको चेतनाको विशिष्ट अवस्थाको प्रत्यक्ष व्यक्तिगत अनुभवमा जोड दिएर अलग गर्न सकिन्छ,।

src: न्युजिल्यान्डका प्रथम बासिन्दा माओरी मानिसहरू थिए र उनीहरूले मोआस भन्ने विशाल चराको शिकार गरेका थिए भन्ने उन्नाइसौं र बीसौं शताब्दीमा लामो समयसम्म विश्वास गरिन्थ्यो। सिद्धान्तले त्यसपछि माओरी जनता पोलिनेसियाबाट ग्रेट फ्लिटमा सरेको र मोरिओरीबाट न्युजिल्यान्ड पुगेको र कृषि समाजको स्थापना गरेको विचार गरे। यद्यपि, नयाँ प्रमाणले संकेत गर्दछ कि मोरीओरी मुख्य भूमि माओरीका एउटा समूह थिए जो आफ्नो विशिष्ट, शान्तिमय संस्कृति विकास गर्दै न्युजिल्यान्डबाट च्याथम टापुहरूमा बसाई सरेका थिए। न्युजील्याण्डबाट टाढा बसाईं सरेर आएका माओरी चथम टापुहरूमा अर्को जाति पनि थिए। तिनीहरूले आफूलाई मोरीओरी भनेर बोलाए त्यहाँ केही झडपहरू भए र अन्त्यमा मोरीओरीहरूलाई भगाइयो।
mt: The first inhabitants of New Zealand were Maori people who hunted the moa, a large bird, according to belief held for long periods in the 20th and 21st centuries. The theory then held that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in the Great Flight and settled in New Zealand from Moriori, who established an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that Moriori was a group of Maori from the main land who developed their own distinct, peaceful culture by migrating from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands. Another group of Maori also migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands. They called themselves Moriori there, and there were some conflicts, and eventually the Moriori were driven out.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: न्युजिल्यान्डका प्रथम बासिन्दा माओरी मानिसहरू थिए र उनीहरूले मोआस भन्ने विशाल चराको शिकार गरेका थिए भन्ने उन्नाइसौं र बीसौं शताब्दीमा लामो समयसम्म विश्वास गरिन्थ्यो। सिद्धान्तले त्यसपछि माओरी जनता पोलिनेसियाबाट ग्रेट फ्लिटमा सरेको र मोरिओरीबाट न्युजिल्यान्ड पुगेको र कृषि समाजको स्थापना गरेको विचार गरे। यद्यपि, नयाँ प्रमाणले संकेत गर्दछ कि मोरीओरी मुख्य भूमि माओरीका एउटा समूह थिए जो आफ्नो विशिष्ट, शान्तिमय संस्कृति विकास गर्दै न्युजिल्यान्डबाट च्याथम टापुहरूमा बसाई सरेका थिए। न्युजील्याण्डबाट टाढा बसाईं सरेर आएका माओरी चथम टापुहरूमा अर्को जाति पनि थिए। तिनीहरूले आफूलाई मोरीओरी भनेर बोलाए त्यहाँ केही झडपहरू भए र अन्त्यमा मोरीओरीहरूलाई भगाइयो।
mt: The first inhabitants of New Zealand were Maori people who hunted the moa, a large bird, according to belief held for long periods in the 20th and 21st centuries. The theory then held that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in the Great Flight and settled in New Zealand from Moriori, who established an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that Moriori was a group of Maori from the main land who developed their own distinct, peaceful culture by migrating from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands. Another group of Maori also migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands. They called themselves Moriori there, and there were some conflicts, and eventually the Moriori were driven out.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: पिओरल्यान्ड ओरिगामी भनेको प्रतिबन्धित ओरीगामी हो जसमा एकपटकमा एक चोटि मात्र पट्याउन सकिन्छ, धेरै जटिल हिसाबले उल्टोसुल्टो गरेर पट्याउन पाइने छैन र सबै पट्याउने काम सीधा स्थानहरूमा हुन्छन्। यो 1970 मा जोन स्मिथद्वारा अनुभवहीन फोल्डर वा सीमित मोटर सिपहरू भएकाहरूलाई मद्दत गर्न विकसित गरिएको थियो।
mt: A Piorland origami is a restricted origami in which only one fold can be made at a time, complex folds cannot be made, and all folds are made in straight places. It was developed in 1970 by John Smith to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: आधुनिक समयका पाकिस्तान र उत्तर पश्चिमी भारत र उत्तर पूर्वी अफगानिस्तानका केही क्षेत्रहरू समेटिएका सिन्धु घाटी सभ्यता उत्तर पश्चिमी भारतीय उपमहाद्वीपमा काँस युगको सभ्यता थियो। यो सभ्यता सिन्धु नदीका घाटीहरूमा फस्टायो जसबाट यसले आफ्नो नाम व्युत्पन्न गर्‍यो। केही विद्वानहरूले अहिलेको सुकेको सरस्वती नदीका घाटीहरूमा पनि सभ्यताहरू अवस्थित भए तापनि, यसलाई व्युत्पतिका आधारमा सिन्धु-सरस्वती सभ्यता भनिनुपर्ने अनुमान गरे, जबकि केहीले यसलाई 1920 को दशकमा उत्खनन गरिएको यसको पहिलो स्थल हारप्पाको नाममा यसलाई हारप्पा सभ्यता भन्छन्।

ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: बहुमतले लाभ उठाउँदा छोटो अवधिमा स्वार्थी व्यवहार गरेर अधिक लाभ प्राप्त गर्ने हुनाले लोभ र स्वार्थ जहिले पनि हामीसँग हुन्छ र यो सहकार्यको प्रकृति हो। आशा छ उनीहरूको दिर्घकालीन उत्तम विकल्प अरूसँग मिलेर काम गर्नु भनेर धेरै मानिसहरूले महसुस गर्ने छन्।
mt: In the short term, self-interested behavior to gain advantage over others can be beneficial, but in the long term, many people will feel that their best interests are served by cooperating with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: बहुमतले लाभ उठाउँदा छोटो अवधिमा स्वार्थी व्यवहार गरेर अधिक लाभ प्राप्त गर्ने हुनाले लोभ र स्वार्थ जहिले पनि हामीसँग हुन्छ र यो सहकार्यको प्रकृति हो। आशा छ उनीहरूको दिर्घकालीन उत्तम विकल्प अरूसँग मिलेर काम गर्नु भनेर धेरै मानिसहरूले महसुस गर्ने छन्।

src: फिलिपिन्सको विजयमा U.S को साम्राज्यवादको युद्धको खर्च फिलिपिन्सका मानिसहरूले स्वयं नै तिरेका थिए। तिनीहरू वाल स्ट्रिट बैंकिङ घरहरूमार्फत फिलिपिन्स सरकारको नाममा खर्चहरूको प्रमुख अंश  र ऋणपत्रको व्याज चुक्ता गर्न संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकी औपनिवेशिक शासनलाई कर तिर्न बाध्य थिए। वास्तवमा, फिलिपिन्सका जनताको लामो शोषणबाट उत्पन्न भएका सुपरप्रोफिटले अमेरिकी साम्राज्यवादको आधारभूत फाइदालाई संघटित गर्छन्।
mt: The Filipinos paid for the war of U.S. imperialism. They were forced to pay the main portion of the costs of the war and the interest on the bonds in the name of the Philippine government to the United States imperialist colonial government through the Wall Street banking houses. In fact, the superprofits generated from the long exploitation of the Filipinos underwrite the basic profit of U.S. imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: टेम्प्ल्रसलाई बुझ्नका लागि त्यो सन्दर्भलाई बुझ्नुपर्छ जसले आदेशको निर्माणलाई प्रेरित गर्‍यो। घटनाहरू घटित भएको युगलाई सामान्यतया युरोपियन इतिहासको 11 औं, 12 औं र 13 औं शताब्दी (AD 1000–1300) को उच्च मध्य युग अवधि भनिन्छ। उच्च मध्य युग सुरुवाती मध्य युगभन्दा भन्दा अगाडि सुरु भयो र त्यसपछि ढिला मध्य युगपछि सुरु भयो जुन परम्पराअनुसार 1500 तिर समाप्त हुन्छ।
mt: To understand the Templars, one must understand the context in which they were formed. The events of the period are usually referred to as the High Middle Ages, a period of European history that began after the Early Middle Ages and before the Late Middle Ages, which is traditionally dated from 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: टेम्प्ल्रसलाई बुझ्नका लागि त्यो सन्दर्भलाई बुझ्नुपर्छ जसले आदेशको निर्माणलाई प्रेरित गर्‍यो। घटनाहरू घटित भएको युगलाई सामान्यतया युरोपियन इतिहासको 11 औं, 12 औं र 13 औं शताब्दी (AD 1000–1300) को उच्च मध्य युग अवधि भनिन्छ। उच्च मध्य युग सुरुवाती मध्य युगभन्दा भन्दा अगाडि सुरु भयो र त्यसपछि ढिला मध्य युगपछि सुरु भयो जुन परम्पराअनुसार 1500 तिर समाप्त हुन्छ।
mt: To understand the Templars, one must understand the context in which they were formed. The events of the period are usually referred to as the High Middle Ages, a period of European history that began after the Early Middle Ages and before the Late Middle Ages, which is traditionally dated from 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: रोमन साम्राज्यको सैन्य प्रकृतिले चिकित्सा प्रगतिहरूको विकासमा राम्रो सहयोग पुर्‍याएको छ। चिकित्सकहरूलाई सम्राट् अगस्टसद्वारा भर्ती गर्न सुरु गरियो र लडाईपछि प्रयोगको लागि पहिलो रोमन मेडिकल कर्प्स समेत गठन गरियो। शल्यचिकित्सकहरूलाई अफिमको बीउबाट निकालिएको मोर्फिन र हेनबानेको बीउबाट स्कोपोलोमाइन लगायत विभिन्न पीडाहरण गर्ने औषधिहरूको बारेमा ज्ञान थियो। तिनीहरू बिरामीलाई ग्याङ्ग्रिनका साथै टुर्नीकेट्सबाट बचाउनका लागि अंग विच्छेदन र रक्तप्रवाह रोक्नका लागि धमनी क्ल्याम्पहरूमा दक्ष भए। धेरै शताब्दीहरूमा, रोमनको साम्राज्यले चिकित्साको क्षेत्रमा ठूलो फाईदा पुर्‍यायो र आज हामीलाई थाहा भएको धेरैजस्तो ज्ञानको निर्माण गर्यो।
mt: The military nature of the Roman state has contributed greatly to the development of medical progress. Physicians were first recruited by Emperor Augustus and the first Roman medical corps was formed for use in battle. Surgeons knew of morphine, extracted from opium, and scopolamine, extracted from henbane, among other painkillers. They were able to save patients by suturing wounds and clamping blood vessels to stop bleeding. For many centuries, the Roman Empire contributed greatly to the field of medicine and much of what we know today was discovered by the Romans.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: रोमन साम्राज्यको सैन्य प्रकृतिले चिकित्सा प्रगतिहरूको विकासमा राम्रो सहयोग पुर्‍याएको छ। चिकित्सकहरूलाई सम्राट् अगस्टसद्वारा भर्ती गर्न सुरु गरियो र लडाईपछि प्रयोगको लागि पहिलो रोमन मेडिकल कर्प्स समेत गठन गरियो। शल्यचिकित्सकहरूलाई अफिमको बीउबाट निकालिएको मोर्फिन र हेनबानेको बीउबाट स्कोपोलोमाइन लगायत विभिन्न पीडाहरण गर्ने औषधिहरूको बारेमा ज्ञान थियो। तिनीहरू बिरामीलाई ग्याङ्ग्रिनका साथै टुर्नीकेट्सबाट बचाउनका लागि अंग विच्छेदन र रक्तप्रवाह रोक्नका लागि धमनी क्ल्याम्पहरूमा दक्ष भए। धेरै शताब्दीहरूमा, रोमनको साम्राज्यले चिकित्साको क्षेत्रमा ठूलो फाईदा पुर्‍यायो र आज हामीलाई थाहा भएको धेरैजस्तो ज्ञानको निर्माण गर्यो।
mt: The military nature of the Roman state has contributed greatly to the development of medical progress. Physicians were first recruited by Emperor Augustus and the first Roman medical corps was formed for use in battle. Surgeons knew of morphine, extracted from opium, and scopolamine, extracted from henbane, among other painkillers. They were able to save patients by suturing wounds and clamping blood vessels to stop bleeding. For many centuries, the Roman Empire contributed greatly to the field of medicine and much of what we know today was discovered by the Romans.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: दृष्टि वा हेर्ने क्षमता दृश्य प्रणाली संवेदनशिक अङ्ग वा आँखामा निर्भर गर्छ। जीवको आवश्यकतामा निर्भर भएर आँखा एकभन्दा धेरै निर्माणहरू हुने गर्छन्। विभिन्न निर्माणहरूका विभिन्न क्षमताहरू हुन्छन्, जुन विभिन्न वेभ-लम्बाईका लागि संवेदनशील हुन्छन् र तीक्ष्णताका विभिन्न डिग्री हुन्छन्, उपयुक्त ईनपुट र विभिन्न संख्याहरूले राम्रोसँग काम गर्नका लागि उनीहरूलाई फरक प्रोसेसिङको पनि आवश्यकता पर्दछ।
mt: The visual or seeing system is dependent on the visual sensory organ or eye. The eye has one or more constructions depending on the need of the organism. Different constructions have different capabilities, which are sensitive to different wavelengths and have different degrees of acuity, and require different processing for appropriate input and different numbers to work well.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: सिख भारतीय उपमहाद्वीपबाट आएको एक धर्म हो। यो 15 औँ शताब्दीमा पञ्जाब क्षेत्रमा हिन्दू परम्पराभित्र रहेको साम्प्रदायिक विभाजनबाट सुरु भएको हो। यद्यपि उनीहरूले यसलाई हिन्दु मूल र परम्परालाई स्वीकार गरेता पनि सिखहरूले आफ्नो आस्थालाई हिन्दु धर्मभन्दा फरक मान्छन्। सिखहरूले आफ्नो धर्मलाई गुरमत भन्दछन्, जुन पन्जावीमा “गुरुको मार्ग” हो। गुरु सबै भारतीय धर्महरूका लागि एक आधारभूत पक्ष हो तर सिख धर्ममा एक महत्त्वको रूपमा लिइएको छ जसले सिख विश्वासहरूको मूल रूप बनाउँछ। यो धर्मको स्थापना 15 औँ शताब्दीमा गुरू नानक (1469–1539) द्वारा भएको थियो। यसमा अरू नौ गुरूहरू उत्तराधिकारको रूपमा रहे।
mt: Sikhism is a religion that originated in the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent around the 15th century. It is one of the world's oldest religions. It preaches a message of devotion and remembrance of God at all times, truthful living, equality of humans, and ecumenicism. Its teachings are compiled in the Guru Granth Sahib, the holy book. Sikhism is the fifth-largest organized religion in the world, with approximately 30 million adherents and is the major religion in the Indian states of Punjab and Haryana; it is also the predominant religion in the Indian Union Territory of Chandigarh. Estimates of worldwide adherents of Sikhism range from 23 to 30 million. Sikhism is the dominant religion in the Indian states of Punjab and Haryana, and in the Indian Union Territory of Chandigarh. In the United Kingdom, there are approximately 500,000 Sikhs. In the United States, there are approximately 500,000 Sikhs. In Canada, there are approximately 500,000 Sikhs. In Australia, there are approximately 100,000 Sikhs. In New Zealand, there are approximately 50,000 Sikhs. In Malaysia, there are approximately 100,000 Sikhs. In Singapore, there are approximately 50,000 Sikhs. In South Africa, there are approximately 100,000 Sikhs. In Kenya, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Tanzania, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Uganda, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Zambia, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Mozambique, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Malawi, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Zimbabwe, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Botswana, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Namibia, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Mauritius, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Fiji, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In India, there are approximately 20,000,000 Sikhs. In Pakistan, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Bangladesh, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Nepal, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Sri Lanka, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Afghanistan, there are approximately 10,000 Sikhs. In Iran
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: ध्यान कमी हुने गडबडी “एक स्नायु समबन्धी सिन्ड्रोम हो जसको उत्कृष्ट परिभाषा दिने त्रय लक्षणहरूमा आवेगशीलता, ध्यानभङ्गता र उच्च गतिविधि वा अत्यधिक ऊर्जा समावेश हुन्छन्। यो सिकाइको असक्षमता होइन, यो सिकाइको समस्या हो; यसले “सबै बच्चाहरूको 3 देखि 5 प्रतिशतलाई असर गर्दछ, शायद 2 मिलियन जति धेरै अमेरिकी बच्चाहरू।” ADD भएका बच्चाहरूसँग विद्यालयको कार्य ध्यान दिने कार्य गाह्रो हुन्छ तर तिनीहरू खेल खेल्न वा मन पर्ने कार्टुन हेर्ने वा विराम चिह्न नलगाइ वाक्य लेख्न मनपराउने जस्ता कुरामा ध्यान केन्द्रित गर्न सक्छन्। उनीहरू दिमागलाई उत्प्रेरित गर्छन् किनकि तिनीहरूको दिमाग सामान्य विधिहरूले उत्प्रेरित गर्न नसक्नाले यी बच्चाहरू धेरै समस्यामा पार्न उनीहरू “जोखिमपूर्ण व्यवहारमा, झगडामा सामेल हुन्छन् र अधिकारिक वर्गलाई चुनौती दिन्छन्”। ADDले अन्य सहपाठीहरूसँगको सम्बन्धलाई प्रभाव पार्दछ किनभने अन्य बच्चाहरूले तिनीहरूले गर्ने तरिकाले किन तिनीहरूले कार्य गर्छन् वा तिनीहरूले गर्ने तरिकाले किन तिनीहरूले उच्चारण गर्छन् वा तिनीहरूको परिपक्वता स्तर भिन्न छ भन्ने कुरा बुझ्न सक्दैनन्।
mt: “A neurological syndrome characterized by three main symptoms: impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excessive energy. This is not a disability, this is a disability problem; it affects “all children 3 to 5 percent, perhaps 2 million American children.” ADD children have trouble paying attention to school work but can focus on playing or watching cartoons they like or writing sentences without punctuation. They stimulate the brain because their brains cannot be stimulated by normal methods. These children are “at risk for behavior problems, fighting, and challenging authority.” ADD affects relationships with other children because they do not understand why they do things the way they do or why they say things the way they say them or why they are more mature than other children.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: जबकि परियोजनामा आधारित शिक्षाले सिक्न सजिलो र अधिक चाखलाग्दो बनाउनु पर्छ, जसले मचान एक कदम अगाडि जान्छ। मचान सिकाईको विधिभन्दा भन्दा बरु एक सहायता हो जसले ती व्यक्तिहरूलाई समर्थन प्रदान गर्दछ जो नयाँ सिकाईको अनुभवबाट गुजरिरहेका हुन्छन् जस्तो कि नयाँ कम्प्युटर कार्यक्रम वा नयाँ परियोजनाको सुरुवातमा हुन्छन्। मचानहरू भर्चुअल र वास्तविक दुबै हुन सक्छ, अर्को शब्दमा भन्नुपर्दा, शिक्षक मचानको रूप हो तर माइक्रोसफ्ट अफिसमा सानो कागजपत्र व्यक्ति पनि हुन्छ। भर्चुअल स्क्याफोल्ड्स सफ्टवेयरमा आन्तरिकरण गरिएको छ र विद्यार्थीलाई एक्लै ह्यान्डल गर्न चुनौतीपूर्ण हुन सक्ने प्रक्रियाहरू प्रश्न गर्ने, तुरून्तै गर्ने र व्याख्या गर्ने उद्देश्यले गरिएको छ।
mt: While project-based learning makes learning easier and more palatable, the scaffolding takes it a step further. Scaffolding is a support that helps those who are going through the experience of learning new things, such as a new computer program or the start of a new project. Scaffolds can be virtual or real, in other words, the teacher is the form of the scaffold but a small piece of paper person in the Microsoft office is also. The virtual scaffolds are internalized in SoftWare and the student is challenged to ask questions, do it immediately, and explain the process with the intention of making it easier.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: माईस्पेस संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकामा प्रयोग गरिएको तेस्रो सर्वाधिक लोकप्रिय वेबसाईंट हो र हालै यसमा 54 मिलियन प्रोफाइलहरू छन्। यी वेबसाइटहरूले, विशेषगरी शिक्षा सेटिङमा धेरै ध्यानाकर्षण पाएका छन्। त्यहाँ यी वेबसाइटहरूमा सकारात्मक पक्षहरू सामेल भएका सजिलैसँग वर्ग पृष्ठ सेटअप गर्न सक्षम हुँदै जुन ब्लग, भिडियो, फोटो र अन्य सुविधा समावेश गर्न सक्छ। किबोर्डको प्रयोग वा हिज्जेका साथ समस्या भोग्ने विद्यार्थीहरूका लागि याद गर्न सजिलो र टाइप गर्न सजिलो बनाउनाले यस पृष्ठलाई सजिलैसँग वेब ठेगाना प्रदान गरेर पहुँच गर्न सकिन्छ। यसलाई पढ्न सजिलो गराउन र चाहेअनुसारको धेरै वा कम रङले अनुकूलन गर्न सकिन्छ।
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States, and recently has had 54 million profiles. These websites, especially in education settings, have received a lot of attention. They allow for easy setup of class pages with positive aspects such as blogs, videos, photos, and other features. For students who have difficulty with keyboarding or typing, this page can be easily accessed by web address. It can be read easily and can be customized with as many or as few colors as desired.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: यद्यपि, सन् 1956 जुनमा पोल्यान्डमा दङ्गा हुँदा ख्रुश्चेभका प्रतिज्ञाहरू जाँचमा राखियो, जहाँ कामदारहरूले खाद्यान्न अभाव र ज्याला कटौतीको विरोध गरिरहेका प्रदर्शन साम्यवाद विरूद्धको सार्वजनिक विरोधमा परिणत भएको थियो। यद्यपि अन्त्यमा, व्यवस्थाको पुनर्स्थापना गर्न ख्रुश्चेभले ट्याङ्कहरू पठाए, उनले केही आर्थिक मागहरूलाई पनि ठाउँ दिए र प्रख्यात ल्याडिस्ल गोमुल्कालाई नयाँ प्रधानमन्त्रीको रूपमा नियुक्त गर्न सहमत भए।
mt: However, in June 1956, riots broke out in Poland, where workers protested against food shortages and wage cuts, turning into a public protest against communism. However, in the end, Khushchev restored the order by sending tanks, he also met some economic demands and appointed Ladislas Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

However, in the end, Khushchev restored the order by sending tanks, he also met some economic demands and appointed Ladislas Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: USSR र संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिका बीचको सहकार्यमा अग्रसर गराउने जर्मन दोस्रो विश्वयुद्धमा दुवै देशको साझा दुश्मन थियो। युद्धको अन्त्यसँगै प्रणाली, प्रक्रिया र संस्कृतिको झगडाले देश पतन भयो। युद्ध समाप्त भएको दुई वर्षपछि, पहिलेका मित्रहरू एकअर्काको शत्रु बने र शीतयुद्ध सुरु भयो। अफ्रिका देखि एसिया, अफगानिस्तान, क्युबा तथा अन्य धेरै ठाउँहरूमा यो अर्को 40 बर्ष सम्म रहेर प्रोक्सी सेनामार्फत लडाईं गर्ने थियो।
mt: The Soviet Union and the United States cooperated to defeat Germany in the Second World War. After the war, the system, process, and culture of the former allies clashed. Two years after the war ended, former allies became enemies and the Cold War began. This lasted for another 40 years, with proxy wars in Africa, Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba, and other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: स्नुयु प्रणाली रगतको बभवाले निरन्तरता दिन र अबाधित केही शरीरका साथबाट स्नायु आयो भेटेको होमोस्टेसिस हुन सक्छ। यी स्नायु आवेगलाई शरीरभरि धेरै छिटो पठाएर शरीरलाई कुनै पनि सम्भावित खतराबाट सुरक्षित राख्नमा मद्दत गर्न सक्छ।
mt: The system can maintain homeostasis by sending nerve impulses to many parts of the body quickly enough to protect the body from any potential danger.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: गिजामा रहेको ग्रेट पिरामिड सातवटा आश्चर्यमध्ये एउटा मात्रै हो जुन अहिले पनि उभिरहेको छ। तेस्रो शताब्दी BCE मा मिश्रिद्वारा बनाइएको, ग्रेट पिरामिड मृत्यु भएका फाराओलाई सम्मान गर्नको लागि निर्मित धेरै ठूला पिरामिड संरचनाहरू मध्ये एक हो। इजिप्टको भ्याली अफ द डेडको गिजा पठार वा “गिजा नेक्रोपोलिस” मा थुप्रै पिरामिडहरू अवस्थित छन् (जसमध्ये द ग्रेट पिरामिड सबैभन्दा ठूलो हो), धेरै साना चिहानहरू, धेरै मन्दिरहरू र ग्रेट स्फिङ्क्स छन्। ग्रेट पिरामिडलाई फारो खुफुको सम्मानका लागि सिर्जना गरिएको थियो र धेरै साना पिरामिड, चिहान र मन्दिरहरू खुफुका श्रीमतीहरू र परिवारका सदस्यहरूलाई सम्मान गर्नका लागि बनाइएको थियो।
mt: 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, one of which still stands: The Great Pyramid of Giza. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid was one of many large pyramid structures built to honor deceased pharaohs. Many smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."
